comentario: Excellent Excellent hotel! Very clean, comfortable , excellent customer service and great location!

Excellent Todo estuvo bien, un par de cosas para mejorar en la variedad del desayuno y dentro de la habitación que no funcionaba la balanza. Pero tuve una estupenda estadía y con gusto regreso y la recomiendo.
MHinostroza
Excellent Was nice

Excellent Great attention. 
Ricardo and staff are on point!
Okay
Excellent Great hotel with excellent staff - centrally located
Excellent Great hotel with excellent dining, centrally located,  is without a doubt one of the best options to stay. A true jewel where you don't expect it.
Excellent Hermoso hotel
Excellent Una grata sorpresa, supero mis expectativas. Muy buena atención del personal del hotel y del restaurante, sin lugar a duda muy recomendable.
Excellent Excelente
Good Very good hotel, the staff very friendly and the hotel very clean
Excellent The place was good, great location and very respectful for COVID times. Overall experience was great

Excellent The hotel is lovely but rooms are not air conditioned or heated- not even a ceiling fan. No windows to the street only windows that open towards the hallway so no ventilation. The suites do have windows to the street that will allow for ventilation. The staff went above and beyond fulfilling any and all requests. The hotel is classy in appearance and the neighborhood seemed safe. There is a pharmacy at the corner of the street next to a small bakery. I would stay again but only in a suite- the staff made up any short comings the property had. Also, if you don’t speak Spanish things may get a bit difficult but pls don’t be rude to them. See more
Excellent

Good Fabulous hotel, just wish everything wasn't closed for Carnival. First receptionist spoke some English and was very helpful. The next day the receptionist spoke no English and couldn't even tell us where there might be an open restaurant. Turns out we found a delicious restaurant right in the hotel!

Excellent The reception was very polite  and told us about what there’s to see and how much it was to get to places  room was clean and very quiet   I would recommend to everyone the city was very safe to go out
Excellent
Excellent charming hotel - we would definitely stay there again
Excellent

Good It was pretty, my room was spacious enough, and the premises were clean except for the first room that I was brought to. There were stains on the end table by the bed and the floor was stained, dirty and had hair on it, as was evidenced when I removed my white socks and they were grimy and had to be thrown away. As a recompense, as I was checking out and pressed the matter, they offered me a free dessert, which made me laugh. BUT, the staff generally was professional and pleasant. The hotel restaurant's food was only so so.
Excellent Gracias x el servicio

Excellent The hotel itself is very nice and pleasant. The view from the upper rooms is unbeatable and a big plus is the amazing staff and the great food. I had a great stay and wish I was able to stay longer.
Excellent Awesome service and delicious buffet breakfast. The parking is a lot difficult to access.
Excellent The property was very nice and very close to the center of town where we walked to. Lots of sites to see in the area

Good Great time in Loja.
Very nice city.
Excellent
Excellent
Excellent They have quality rooms and the facilities. The staff is amazing and will go out of their way to help

Excellent The staff is amazing. The rooms are luxurious and comfortable. Pool, the sauna and the gym are great. Breakfast is varied and delicious. Best hotel I have stayed in Ecuador
 I will definitely return next time I am in Loja
Excellent It was a great experience!
Okay Location is good. Breakfast is really poor.
Good Nice clean, comfortable room, and excellent value
Okay To much street noise  at night in front rooms
Excellent Great location close to sightseeing, food, shopping with a helpful friendly staff. Comfortable clean rooms with a bath that provides a good hot shower. Well worth the money.

Excellent Everything was perfect. The staff were very nice from the beginning to the end of our journey. The room was impeccable and the breakfast was delicious. Without a doubt, I will book a room in Hotel Podocarpus next time I will be in Loja.
Excellent Great location service was great people were helpfull.
Good Good location. Pleasant staff. Near all places of interest
Good Good service, good location, personal friendly... I’ll be back

Okay The staff was kind enough. The rooms are very dated. They are also very noisy. The bed sleeps like a rack. The bathroom was clumsy and hard to use. The WiFi was almost nonexistent. I had to time it just right just to check my email. We were booked for 5 nights, we left after 2.

Okay The good: The hotel is clean and well maintained. It is centrally located within easy walking distance of shopping, dining and tourist sights in Loja. The breakfast was good. The water was hot enough to shower comfortably after a wait to get warm. The wifi was pretty reliable.  The staff was generally friendly and tried to be helpful. Water dispensers were available in the lobby and on our floor. 
The bad: our room was in the front of the hotel and it was loud even by Ecuadorian standards.  The noise culminated with the police using a loudspeaker to intervene in a domestic situation taking place across the street with a bullhorn at 0200. The beds gave new meaning to "firm".  It was like sleeping on a board with a blanket on top.  They were very uncomfortable.  The staff speaks very little English and with my limited Spanish, it was difficult at times.  To be fair, they were very patient and nice about my language shortcomings. There was a misunderstanding about the number of people in our party. There were 4 instead of the 2 listed on the reservation.  Someone spoke to the other people in the group about some additional charges but it was apparently straightened out. When I checked out there was no mention of it. I assume that it was because the hotel is new to Expedia. See more
Terrible

Excellent Excellent location; walkable. The receptionists were excellent and very helpful. The bell boy Angel was excellent! He did his best to always speak English to us and to help us with maps, etc. Our room was perfect. We had a buffet breakfast which was wonderful. We would definitely stay there again.
Okay
Excellent Great value. We were very pleased with our stay. Would return again and hope to do so very soon.
Excellent
Okay
Good

Excellent El personal que atiende es muy servicial y diligente y la ubicación es muy buena para hacerle turismo.  
Un pequeño detalle: la refrigeradora hace un poco de bulla,  sobre todo en la noche es más notorio.
Good

Excellent muy buen hotel. habitaciones amplias, pero servicios higienicos necesitan mas ventilacion.
excelente desayuno.
Good
Excellent Central location, helpful staff, good greakfast, comfortable room, bathtub, hot water

Okay The access to the hotel is very narrow road, to go down into the parking is incredibley steep and to come back up worst, Limited parking space. 
We stayed there 3 different times, the first 2 times they had some kind of parties happening there, and was loud.   No sleep till about 2;30 AM
Last time was okay. 

Staff is friendly and helpful

Good The room was comfortable in line with their star rating. Spacious room but the window shades not dark enough to offset the street  lights. The hotel is very close to a church which makes impossible to get a good night sleep because every hour the church bell goes off.  The area is busy during the day but very quiet at night. The breakfasts is well below average.  Also, hotel has no AC

Excellent Zamorano Real is located in central Loja close to everything, and the facilities are beautifully kept. The best part is the staff who were friendly and welcoming, calling taxis for us, and keeping our luaggage safe for a while after check-out. There was a little street noise around 10-11 but all quieted down after that- the beds and pillows are wonderful, and we slept well. Breakfast was good.
Good Great hotel only disappointment was the dirty carpet

Good The hotel is confortable and quite new. The rooms and the service is nice; however we had a problem with the access: the roads were broken due to cable and pipes instalation all around the hotel. We had to walk two blocks pulling our luggage and park our car six blocks away, that was disgusting because we weren't tell in advance.

Excellent In a country of "good enough", this was a pleasant surprise. A clean, modern hotel with helpful staff. The hotel has its own parking which is a bonus (very tight). I would definitely choose this hotel again

Good After a shaky late Sunday night check in because of a language barrier and a misunderstanding the Zamorano Real was Really a wonderful treat! Clean, comfortable, great location, HOT shower, great staff.... super helpful people, nice breakfast.  One small complaint....the room walls are thin....I can hear and smell the people in the next room.
Okay
Excellent
Good Lots of great things about this place, specially enjoyed the beautiful grounds, the restaurant and the friendly staff. It's also located a walking distance from Vilcanamba's central park
Good Beautiful setting.
Excellent We loved the gardens and the pool area. Good breakfast, responsive staff. The hot tub, after horseback riding, was just the ticket. Would definitely recommend this place.
Excellent

Terrible Was terrible.. worse experience in a hotel !! Room smells like sewer ,dirty,etc.etc.dont ever go there

Excellent Great place!

Good Great value for an overnight stay. Pleasant and friendly staff. Parking is a bit of a problem as its an underground ramp. The room had no hot water but the staff accommodated us by allowing us to use another rooms shower. Very noisy at night, lots of dog barking. Rooms were new spacious clean and new comfortable beds. Good value for the money.
Good
Excellent
Okay
Excellent

Excellent The hotel is beautiful, a new property but nevertheless with a great history in the vecinity with the old Ambato cotton fabric. Quiet stay and very comfortable bed. The service given by the staff was superb from entry until check out. A place with a fantastic view of the mountains of Ambato and very nice resting spot for the night. Good pressure in the shower for a relaxing time. Recommended.
Excellent Muy bueno el baño limpio
Excellent
Good
Terrible El servicio es malo, la recepcion no es buena. Me quisieron cobrar 2 veces. TERRIBLE
Excellent Si te gusta la naturaleza y conocer culturas y trdiciones, este es el lugar ideal. Alonzo es un anfitrion espectacular y sus historias son increibles!
Excellent

Excellent Foi o melhor lugar que nos hospedamos em toda a viagem ao Equador. Sebastian e Maria são extremamente gentis e hospitaleiros. A casa é linda, muito limpa.Os hospédes não entram com seus calçados, o que favorece ainda mais a limpeza e tem um aroma de eucalipto muito agradável. O quarto é bom, muito espaçoso. Bem localizado, muito perto do Centro, mas em uma área ao mesmo tempo bem tranquila. Voltaria a me hospedar novamente, sem a menor sombra de dúvidas e super indico.
Excellent This friendly, funky, family-run guesthouse offers tremendous value for your money. Conveniently located, generally quiet. I enjoyed hanging out in the deck too.

Excellent From the outside, you might think you made a mistake!  But then you go to the entrance and you see a beautiful eco-hotel.  Saul is an amazing host!  He served ya a delicious breakfast in the morning and then was our tour guide for the day.  He also helped ya fix our tire that someone had let the air out of.   The room we stayed in was spacious and comfortable and “rustic” in a good way.  I highly recommend this place to stay...and suggest you spend more than a day in Baños.

Excellent Hotel is owned by a local family who were all really nice and friendly. Darwin’s dog Pichuca was also really cute! Rooms were big and shower temperature and pressure was good. Breakfast was simple but good and really fresh.

Terrible No privacy in room (window can't be completely blocked with curtain, people walking by, and zero sound proofing, no working wifi.  Never tried hot water, left asap in morning.  But owners were very nice and tried to apologize and accomodate. 1 or 2 extra rooms were under construction(almost done) so could be better in future.
Terrible

Excellent Petit hôtel très mignon, géré par un proprio très attentionné et sympathique qui a vécu de nombreuses années en Suisse avant de revenir en Equateur.
On est baigné dans une atmosphère très familiale, et on a le privilège d'être légèrement décalés de la rue, ce qui limite les nuisances sonores. 
Rencontres avec les autres voyageurs  facilitées grâce à la cuisine commune très pratique, toit terrasse très agréable également.
Petit déjeuner pas mal du tout, avec du très très bon pain !
A noter :
- les chambres paraissent inégales, ne pas hésiter à les visiter pour choisir. 
- pour les excursions, il est préférable de les réserver directement dans les agences afin d'éviter la commission de l'hôtel.See more
Excellent

Excellent Excelente ubicación y atención de Saúl. Muy familiar, buena señal de wifi y tv. Dejamos la sugerencia para modificar mobiliario ya que el espacio disponible es reducido. Buen asesoramiento para actividades a realizar. Imperdible el tour a la selva con Saúl y Germán como guías.
Excellent Excelente la atención y la amabilidad de sus dueños, el desayuno muy fresco y natural, el lugar es bien agradable, regresaría de nuevo :)
Excellent

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario: Excellent Nice quiet place. A little far from the city center.

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario: Okay

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario: Excellent Very clean and comfortable with good shared facilities. Great for a base for a few days!

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario: Okay I don't want to be a bad guy, but I got there and no one was there to greet me.  Possibly there was some kind of confusion or who knows.   But I chose not to stay at their place. and I wish them the best.

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario: Good Require fifteen minutes walking uphill to reach it. Nice layout of room and patio. Only concern too dark while staying in room, not able to read during the night.

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario: Okay Out of the centre of town but closer to one of the thermal baths, bed was comfortable and shower was good, WiFi was good as long as the hostel isn't full. Good idea of energy saving at the hostel. Nice set up for movies. When the hostel is full it can be very noisy, breakfast was nice but economical.

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario: Excellent

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario:
Excellent I don’t know how anyone could rate this place less than excellent...especially considering the awesome staff. Whomever gave negative reviews must be very difficult guests because the staff far exceeded my expectations.

*Clean, economical rooms
*Beer, bottled drinks, wine, even massages in house that you can purchase onsite
*the most helpful staff ever...booked tours for us for way cheaper than we could find on our own, English speaking, and consistently went above and beyond. Helped us avoid missing our flight by explaining the am bus schedule and that we wouldn’t make it to Quito in time. Then she booked a taxi for us (our only option as we had to leave at 3am) and GOT UP AT 3 AM to escort us to the taxi!
*very delicious breakfast that changes everyday. You even have the option to add to it for additional cost. Great, friendly cook.
*Cheap laundry service!

Say here, you won’t regret it. See more

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario: Excellent Great space, friendly staff and and helpful staff. Location out of the way but facilities make up for it.

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario:
Good Great breakfast, good, clean, spacious bathroom and quiet location. It’s up the hill away from the bustle & noise of the centre of Baños but everything is a 5 minute walk. 
Met lovely people here.

Good The room was comfortable in line with their star rating. Spacious room but the window shades not dark enough to offset the street  lights. The hotel is very close to a church which makes impossible to get a good night sleep because every hour the church bell goes off.  The area is busy during the day but very quiet at night. The breakfasts is well below average.  Also, hotel has no AC

Excellent Zamorano Real is located in central Loja close to everything, and the facilities are beautifully kept. The best part is the staff who were friendly and welcoming, calling taxis for us, and keeping our luaggage safe for a while after check-out. There was a little street noise around 10-11 but all quieted down after that- the beds and pillows are wonderful, and we slept well. Breakfast was good.

Excellent In a country of "good enough", this was a pleasant surprise. A clean, modern hotel with helpful staff. The hotel has its own parking which is a bonus (very tight). I would definitely choose this hotel again

Excellent The hotel is lovely but rooms are not air conditioned or heated- not even a ceiling fan. No windows to the street only windows that open towards the hallway so no ventilation. The suites do have windows to the street that will allow for ventilation. The staff went above and beyond fulfilling any and all requests. The hotel is classy in appearance and the neighborhood seemed safe. There is a pharmacy at the corner of the street next to a small bakery. I would stay again but only in a suite- the staff made up any short comings the property had. Also, if you don’t speak Spanish things may get a bit difficult but pls don’t be rude to them. See more

As a recompense, as I was checking out and pressed the matter, they offered me a free dessert, which made me laugh. BUT, the staff generally was professional and pleasant. The hotel restaurant's food was only so so.

Okay The good: The hotel is clean and well maintained. It is centrally located within easy walking distance of shopping, dining and tourist sights in Loja. The breakfast was good. The water was hot enough to shower comfortably after a wait to get warm. The wifi was pretty reliable.  The staff was generally friendly and tried to be helpful. Water dispensers were available in the lobby and on our floor. 
The bad: our room was in the front of the hotel and it was loud even by Ecuadorian standards.  The noise culminated with the police using a loudspeaker to intervene in a domestic situation taking place across the street with a bullhorn at 0200. The beds gave new meaning to "firm".  It was like sleeping on a board with a blanket on top.  They were very uncomfortable.  The staff speaks very little English and with my limited Spanish, it was difficult at times.  To be fair, they were very patient and nice about my language shortcomings. There was a misunderstanding about the number of people in our party. There were 4 instead of the 2 listed on the reservation.  Someone spoke to the other people in the group about some additional charges but it was apparently straightened out. When I checked out there was no mention of it. I assume that it was because the hotel is new to Expedia. See more
Terrible

Excellent Excellent location; walkable. The receptionists were excellent and very helpful. The bell boy Angel was excellent! He did his best to always speak English to us and to help us with maps, etc. Our room was perfect. We had a buffet breakfast which was wonderful. We would definitely stay there again.

Excellent Foi o melhor lugar que nos hospedamos em toda a viagem ao Equador. Sebastian e Maria são extremamente gentis e hospitaleiros. A casa é linda, muito limpa.Os hospédes não entram com seus calçados, o que favorece ainda mais a limpeza e tem um aroma de eucalipto muito agradável. O quarto é bom, muito espaçoso. Bem localizado, muito perto do Centro, mas em uma área ao mesmo tempo bem tranquila. Voltaria a me hospedar novamente, sem a menor sombra de dúvidas e super indico.
Excellent This friendly, funky, family-run guesthouse offers tremendous value for your money. Conveniently located, generally quiet. I enjoyed hanging out in the deck too.

Excellent From the outside, you might think you made a mistake!  But then you go to the entrance and you see a beautiful eco-hotel.  Saul is an amazing host!  He served ya a delicious breakfast in the morning and then was our tour guide for the day.  He also helped ya fix our tire that someone had let the air out of.   The room we stayed in was spacious and comfortable and “rustic” in a good way.  I highly recommend this place to stay...and suggest you spend more than a day in Baños.

Excellent Hotel is owned by a local family who were all really nice and friendly. Darwin’s dog Pichuca was also really cute! Rooms were big and shower temperature and pressure was good. Breakfast was simple but good and really fresh.

Terrible No privacy in room (window can't be completely blocked with curtain, people walking by, and zero sound proofing, no working wifi.  Never tried hot water, left asap in morning.  But owners were very nice and tried to apologize and accomodate. 1 or 2 extra rooms were under construction(almost done) so could be better in future.
Terrible

Excellent Petit hôtel très mignon, géré par un proprio très attentionné et sympathique qui a vécu de nombreuses années en Suisse avant de revenir en Equateur.
On est baigné dans une atmosphère très familiale, et on a le privilège d'être légèrement décalés de la rue, ce qui limite les nuisances sonores. 
Rencontres avec les autres voyageurs  facilitées grâce à la cuisine commune très pratique, toit terrasse très agréable également.
Petit déjeuner pas mal du tout, avec du très très bon pain !
A noter :
- les chambres paraissent inégales, ne pas hésiter à les visiter pour choisir. 
- pour les excursions, il est préférable de les réserver directement dans les agences afin d'éviter la commission de l'hôtel.See more
Excellent

Excellent Excelente ubicación y atención de Saúl. Muy familiar, buena señal de wifi y tv. Dejamos la sugerencia para modificar mobiliario ya que el espacio disponible es reducido. Buen asesoramiento para actividades a realizar. Imperdible el tour a la selva con Saúl y Germán como guías.

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario:
Excellent I don’t know how anyone could rate this place less than excellent...especially considering the awesome staff. Whomever gave negative reviews must be very difficult guests because the staff far exceeded my expectations.

*Clean, economical rooms
*Beer, bottled drinks, wine, even massages in house that you can purchase onsite
*the most helpful staff ever...booked tours for us for way cheaper than we could find on our own, English speaking, and consistently went above and beyond. Helped us avoid missing our flight by explaining the am bus schedule and that we wouldn’t make it to Quito in time. Then she booked a taxi for us (our only option as we had to leave at 3am) and GOT UP AT 3 AM to escort us to the taxi!
*very delicious breakfast that changes everyday. You even have the option to add to it for additional cost. Great, friendly cook.
*Cheap laundry service!

Say here, you won’t regret it. See more

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario: Excellent Great space, friendly staff and and helpful staff. Location out of the way but facilities make up for it.

The room is quiet, and the clothes dry fast...all these mean the construction team might add enough insulation for each demising wall and exterior so I can feel a comfortable environment. Also, the internet is fast. That supports me to work remotely. Sheraton staff are very professional, helpful, and friendly.

nombreh_id: Old Town Quito Suites, Apartments & Boutique hotel
comentario: Excellent This is a beautiful hotel. I highly recommend this to any traveler looking for a bit of relaxation in a busy city. The space is beautifully decorated and very clean. The little touches like fresh bread every morning, stocked fridge and coffee make the space special. The staff and owner, Joz, Edison, Jhon and Dirk, are lovely people and incredibly kind. Very communicate and offer great suggestions where to visit and eat. Next time I visit, I will definitely stay here again.

nombreh_id: Old Town Quito Suites, Apartments & Boutique hotel
comentario: Excellent Yo ha viajado mucho los pasados 20 años. Old Town Quito Hotel es el mejor apartamento que ha tenido. Cada vez que regreso al Quito voy quedar en Oid Town Quito Hotel. Excelente y extrodinario!

comentario: Excellent Spacious well equipped suite with separate living room and kitchen in beautifully restored building next to the historic centre. A very comfortable base for exploring Quito at a reasonable price.

nombreh_id: Old Town Quito Suites, Apartments & Boutique hotel
comentario: Excellent This hotel was perfect for our family of four! The suites are very spacious and well decorated. The staff is extremely nice and helpful. The fridge is stocked every day with breakfast items, which was a very nice touch. There are several restaurants on that street and the heart of old town is just a quick walk away. Amazing place which I highly recommend!

Excellent This refurbished Colonial home with interior courtyard was wonderful for our first trip to Quito. In fact we stayed on the way to the Gallapagos & on the way back. All the staff was very helpful and breakfast of fruit eggs & fresh bread was included. One warning, no elevator, & some rooms are on the 5th or 6th level! The view from the rooftop deck was amazing. They were also very accommodating to change our rooms to the 2nd floor when we asked. I would definitely stay again. The airport transportation was also inexpensive & reliable.See more
Excellent
Excellent Great hotel & location! Nice staff & would stay here again. Highly recommend!

Good The place is awesome. The location is incredible. And the hotel is in good shape. But the service was awful, they offer you a simple breakfast where you are not able to ask for something different than scramble eggs, not even sunny side of or a tortilla. The staff does not show the hotel around and they make it look as it is a place to crush. It is one of the most beautiful places to stay at the center of Quito. But all the crew do not care about it. They don’t even tell you what places can you visit or where to eat since they close their beautiful dinning room for the whole day. It is really sad to see a place with such an amazing potencial to be left like a place to only spend the night. See more

Excellent Everything about our stay was wonderful! Casa Gangotena used to be a mansion and it is beautiful! The service was top notch. Good Everything was great, the hotel is well located and is very artsy with a little art gallery. Overall it a great hotel with those small exceptions.

Excellent The hotel is lovely but rooms are not air conditioned or heated- not even a ceiling fan. No windows to the street only windows that open towards the hallway so no ventilation. The hotel is classy in appearance and the neighborhood seemed safe. There is a pharmacy at the corner of the street next to a small bakery. I would stay again but only in a suite- the staff made up any short comings the property had. Also, if you don’t speak Spanish things may get a bit difficult but pls don’t be rude to them. See more

Okay The staff was kind enough. The rooms are very dated. They are also very noisy. The bed sleeps like a rack. The bathroom was clumsy and hard to use. The WiFi was almost nonexistent. I had to time it just right just to check my email. We were booked for 5 nights, we left after 2.

Okay The good: The hotel is clean and well maintained. It is centrally located within easy walking distance of shopping, dining and tourist sights in Loja. The breakfast was good. The water was hot enough to shower comfortably after a wait to get warm. The wifi was pretty reliable.  The staff was generally friendly and tried to be helpful. Water dispensers were available in the lobby and on our floor. 
The bad: our room was in the front of the hotel and it was loud even by Ecuadorian standards.  The noise culminated with the police using a loudspeaker to intervene in a domestic situation taking place across the street with a bullhorn at 0200. The beds gave new meaning to "firm".  It was like sleeping on a board with a blanket on top.  They were very uncomfortable.  The staff speaks very little English and with my limited Spanish, it was difficult at times.  To be fair, they were very patient and nice about my language shortcomings. There was a misunderstanding about the number of people in our party. There were 4 instead of the 2 listed on the reservation.  Someone spoke to the other people in the group about some additional charges but it was apparently straightened out. When I checked out there was no mention of it. I assume that it was because the hotel is new to Expedia. See more
Terrible

Excellent Excellent location; walkable. The receptionists were excellent and very helpful. The bell boy Angel was excellent! He did his best to always speak English to us and to help us with maps, etc. Our room was perfect. We had a buffet breakfast which was wonderful. We would definitely stay there again.

Excellent Foi o melhor lugar que nos hospedamos em toda a viagem ao Equador. Sebastian e Maria são extremamente gentis e hospitaleiros. A casa é linda, muito limpa.Os hospédes não entram com seus calçados, o que favorece ainda mais a limpeza e tem um aroma de eucalipto muito agradável. O quarto é bom, muito espaçoso. Bem localizado, muito perto do Centro, mas em uma área ao mesmo tempo bem tranquila. Voltaria a me hospedar novamente, sem a menor sombra de dúvidas e super indico.
Excellent This friendly, funky, family-run guesthouse offers tremendous value for your money. Conveniently located, generally quiet. I enjoyed hanging out in the deck too.

Excellent From the outside, you might think you made a mistake!  But then you go to the entrance and you see a beautiful eco-hotel.  Saul is an amazing host!  He served ya a delicious breakfast in the morning and then was our tour guide for the day.  He also helped ya fix our tire that someone had let the air out of.   The room we stayed in was spacious and comfortable and “rustic” in a good way.  I highly recommend this place to stay...and suggest you spend more than a day in Baños.

Excellent Hotel is owned by a local family who were all really nice and friendly. Darwin’s dog Pichuca was also really cute! Rooms were big and shower temperature and pressure was good. Breakfast was simple but good and really fresh.

Terrible No privacy in room (window can't be completely blocked with curtain, people walking by, and zero sound proofing, no working wifi.  Never tried hot water, left asap in morning.  But owners were very nice and tried to apologize and accomodate. 1 or 2 extra rooms were under construction(almost done) so could be better in future.
Terrible

Excellent Petit hôtel très mignon, géré par un proprio très attentionné et sympathique qui a vécu de nombreuses années en Suisse avant de revenir en Equateur.
On est baigné dans une atmosphère très familiale, et on a le privilège d'être légèrement décalés de la rue, ce qui limite les nuisances sonores. 
Rencontres avec les autres voyageurs  facilitées grâce à la cuisine commune très pratique, toit terrasse très agréable également.
Petit déjeuner pas mal du tout, avec du très très bon pain !
A noter :
- les chambres paraissent inégales, ne pas hésiter à les visiter pour choisir. 
- pour les excursions, il est préférable de les réserver directement dans les agences afin d'éviter la commission de l'hôtel.See more
Excellent

Excellent Excelente ubicación y atención de Saúl. Muy familiar, buena señal de wifi y tv. Dejamos la sugerencia para modificar mobiliario ya que el espacio disponible es reducido. Buen asesoramiento para actividades a realizar. Imperdible el tour a la selva con Saúl y Germán como guías.
Excellent Excelente la atención y la amabilidad de sus dueños, el desayuno muy fresco y natural, el lugar es bien agradable, regresaría de nuevo :)

comentario:
Excellent I don’t know how anyone could rate this place less than excellent...especially considering the awesome staff. Whomever gave negative reviews must be very difficult guests because the staff far exceeded my expectations.

*Clean, economical rooms
*Beer, bottled drinks, wine, even massages in house that you can purchase onsite
*the most helpful staff ever...booked tours for us for way cheaper than we could find on our own, English speaking, and consistently went above and beyond. Helped us avoid missing our flight by explaining the am bus schedule and that we wouldn’t make it to Quito in time. Then she booked a taxi for us (our only option as we had to leave at 3am) and GOT UP AT 3 AM to escort us to the taxi!
*very delicious breakfast that changes everyday. You even have the option to add to it for additional cost. Great, friendly cook.
*Cheap laundry service!

Say here, you won’t regret it. See more

Excellent The hotel is lovely but rooms are not air conditioned or heated- not even a ceiling fan. No windows to the street only windows that open towards the hallway so no ventilation. The suites do have windows to the street that will allow for ventilation. The staff went above and beyond fulfilling any and all requests. The hotel is classy in appearance and the neighborhood seemed safe. There is a pharmacy at the corner of the street next to a small bakery. I would stay again but only in a suite- the staff made up any short comings the property had. Also, if you don’t speak Spanish things may get a bit difficult but pls don’t be rude to them. See more

Okay The staff was kind enough. The rooms are very dated. They are also very noisy. The bed sleeps like a rack. The bathroom was clumsy and hard to use. The WiFi was almost nonexistent. I had to time it just right just to check my email. We were booked for 5 nights, we left after 2.

Okay The good: The hotel is clean and well maintained. It is centrally located within easy walking distance of shopping, dining and tourist sights in Loja. The breakfast was good. The water was hot enough to shower comfortably after a wait to get warm. The wifi was pretty reliable.  The staff was generally friendly and tried to be helpful. Water dispensers were available in the lobby and on our floor. 
The bad: our room was in the front of the hotel and it was loud even by Ecuadorian standards.  The noise culminated with the police using a loudspeaker to intervene in a domestic situation taking place across the street with a bullhorn at 0200. The beds gave new meaning to "firm".  It was like sleeping on a board with a blanket on top.  They were very uncomfortable.  The staff speaks very little English and with my limited Spanish, it was difficult at times.  To be fair, they were very patient and nice about my language shortcomings. There was a misunderstanding about the number of people in our party. There were 4 instead of the 2 listed on the reservation.  Someone spoke to the other people in the group about some additional charges but it was apparently straightened out. When I checked out there was no mention of it. I assume that it was because the hotel is new to Expedia. See more
Terrible

Excellent Excellent location; walkable. The receptionists were excellent and very helpful. The bell boy Angel was excellent! He did his best to always speak English to us and to help us with maps, etc. Our room was perfect. We had a buffet breakfast which was wonderful. We would definitely stay there again.
Okay

Excellent

Excellent Foi o melhor lugar que nos hospedamos em toda a viagem ao Equador. Sebastian e Maria são extremamente gentis e hospitaleiros. A casa é linda, muito limpa.Os hospédes não entram com seus calçados, o que favorece ainda mais a limpeza e tem um aroma de eucalipto muito agradável. O quarto é bom, muito espaçoso. Bem localizado, muito perto do Centro, mas em uma área ao mesmo tempo bem tranquila. Voltaria a me hospedar novamente, sem a menor sombra de dúvidas e super indico.
Excellent This friendly, funky, family-run guesthouse offers tremendous value for your money. Conveniently located, generally quiet. I enjoyed hanging out in the deck too.

Excellent From the outside, you might think you made a mistake!  But then you go to the entrance and you see a beautiful eco-hotel.  Saul is an amazing host!  He served ya a delicious breakfast in the morning and then was our tour guide for the day.  He also helped ya fix our tire that someone had let the air out of.   The room we stayed in was spacious and comfortable and “rustic” in a good way.  I highly recommend this place to stay...and suggest you spend more than a day in Baños.

Excellent Hotel is owned by a local family who were all really nice and friendly. Darwin’s dog Pichuca was also really cute! Rooms were big and shower temperature and pressure was good. Breakfast was simple but good and really fresh.

Terrible No privacy in room (window can't be completely blocked with curtain, people walking by, and zero sound proofing, no working wifi.  Never tried hot water, left asap in morning.  But owners were very nice and tried to apologize and accomodate. 1 or 2 extra rooms were under construction(almost done) so could be better in future.
Terrible

Excellent Petit hôtel très mignon, géré par un proprio très attentionné et sympathique qui a vécu de nombreuses années en Suisse avant de revenir en Equateur.
On est baigné dans une atmosphère très familiale, et on a le privilège d'être légèrement décalés de la rue, ce qui limite les nuisances sonores. 
Rencontres avec les autres voyageurs  facilitées grâce à la cuisine commune très pratique, toit terrasse très agréable également.
Petit déjeuner pas mal du tout, avec du très très bon pain !
A noter :
- les chambres paraissent inégales, ne pas hésiter à les visiter pour choisir. 
- pour les excursions, il est préférable de les réserver directement dans les agences afin d'éviter la commission de l'hôtel.See more
Excellent

Excellent Excelente ubicación y atención de Saúl. Muy familiar, buena señal de wifi y tv. Dejamos la sugerencia para modificar mobiliario ya que el espacio disponible es reducido. Buen asesoramiento para actividades a realizar. Imperdible el tour a la selva con Saúl y Germán como guías.
Excellent Excelente la atención y la amabilidad de sus dueños, el desayuno muy fresco y natural, el lugar es bien agradable, regresaría de nuevo :)

The room is quiet, and the clothes dry fast...all these mean the construction team might add enough insulation for each demising wall and exterior so I can feel a comfortable environment. Also, the internet is fast. That supports me to work remotely. Sheraton staff are very professional, helpful, and friendly.

nombreh_id: Old Town Quito Suites, Apartments & Boutique hotel
comentario: Excellent This is a beautiful hotel. I highly recommend this to any traveler looking for a bit of relaxation in a busy city. The space is beautifully decorated and very clean. The little touches like fresh bread every morning, stocked fridge and coffee make the space special. The staff and owner, Joz, Edison, Jhon and Dirk, are lovely people and incredibly kind. Very communicate and offer great suggestions where to visit and eat. Next time I visit, I will definitely stay here again.

nombreh_id: Old Town Quito Suites, Apartments & Boutique hotel
comentario: Excellent Yo ha viajado mucho los pasados 20 años. Old Town Quito Hotel es el mejor apartamento que ha tenido. Cada vez que regreso al Quito voy quedar en Oid Town Quito Hotel. Excelente y extrodinario!

Excellent What a beautiful and relaxing place. There's an excellent staff, a tasty restaurant on site, and many things to do if your decide to hang out on the grounds.  It was a very romantic setting with incredible attention to detail. The gardens are amazing. The room was comfortable. They built a fire each night in our room and provided cool hot water bottles to go under the blankets at night, though we never found it particularly cold when we went in October.

But seriously, with Cerro Imbabura rising majestically on one side, and the tranquil waters of Lago San Pablo on the other, it's hard to ask for more. Just don't get too worried as you drive through a very common Ecuadorian neighborhood on the way there. You may think, "where am I going?" But once you arrive, you'll feel like you found a piece of heaven. I sure did!See more

Excellent OUTSTANDING! This was a perfect place for our stay in Ecuador. Carlos and Doreen are wonderful hosts, (they both speak English and Spanish) but they also are educators for their guests and their community. The facilities are the cleanest we have stayed in, consistent on demand hot water, wonderful continental breakfast, large rooms, quiet environment, friendly and helpful staff, wonderful views of the surrounding mountains, family oriented (games, soccer, badminton, lamas, horses ) and owners that will assist you with arranging local attractions.See more

Good The accommodations that we had were for 3 people and were in the older part of the building. The rooms were clean and adequate but not fancy. What makes this property special are the staff. Everyone was so kind and helpful. They organized our transportation from Quito airport and were happy to do some much needed laundry for us. The owner was very helpful in his suggestions on what to do in the town.
The inner courtyard was a lovely space to enjoy the very tasty breakfast (best juice we had in Ecuador!). There was minimal street noise despite it's central location. We would not hesitate to stay there again. It was great value for money!See more

Excellent Amazing place! Great location, but very quiet if you get a room garden side. Freddy is absolutely fabulous and helpful. He drove me to the safe parking up the ride and gave me rides back. Breakfast was great too, with a new juice everyday. Totally recommend this place!

Excellent We loved this hotel. Freddie is absolutely fabulous. Very friendly and drove me to an secured off site parking. The room was very spacious and clean. The breakfast was Lovely too and the location is perfect. I would highly recommend.

Excellent We were only supposed to stay in Otavalo for one night, but a mishap with not getting our rental car forced us to change our plans drastically and we ended up staying here for 4 nights. We were honestly very happy that it happened.
The hostel is very well taken care of. The owner does speak English, the rest of the staff speaks little but they were all very helpful and attentive.
Breakfast each morning was bread/butter/jam, juice, eggs and coffee. The location is great, very close to the town square and the daily markets. The garden area inside was gorgeous. We were even able to have our laundry done. The owner also has a trusted contact for longer drives outside of the city if needed. We utilized this for an afternoon hike and a visit to Cotocachi (which is a must if you are in this area).

Overall, this is a wonderful hostel in Otavalo with friendly staff, a convenient location, and a great atmosphere.See more

Good Hotel with endless charm and character, people running it are amazing, helpful, kept our luggage until the following night, so we could enjoy Otavalo until we had to catch our late night flight. 
Like most of the historic hotels it gets cold at night and the bathrooms are functioning at varying degrees, but the shower was hot.
Excellent It's a great hotel in a perfect location. The staff could not have been nicer!
Good Comfortable and quiet facility within a few blocks of the markets. Day staff usually spoke English and could help you with your interests.
Excellent Great staff and the owners were very friendly and informative. Staff went out of way to assist us. Great breakfast.
Excellent Lovely spot, close to the market.The staff was extremely helpful.  Really enjoyed our stay!
Good Very small hotel but nice location. The only complaint we had was there was a dog that barked almost all night and kept us awake! It’s quite open aired so we heard every noise.
Excellent The staff is amazing. The location is excellent. The food was unbelievable and totally delicious.
Good Lovely historic hotel.   Great location.  Very good restaurant.  Helpful staff.

Good This place is right in the middle of the town, walking distance to the famous Saturday market, close to restaurants, very nice and helpful staff, the room is basic nothing fancy but very clean and there’s hot water, very good breakfast. I highly recommend this place especially for mid budget.

Good Property is mostly charming and the staff is fantastic-Lucy, Vladamir and the rest were great.  Property is a little downtrodden however and we felt quite expensive for Ecuador.  Parking costs $4 per day but they charge extra for additional hours.  Cleanliness could be improved but not bad overall.  Food is good especially pizza and breakfast. Location is great right next to the market.  We ended up paying about $50 per night with the parking added in.  Should be no more than $35

Excellent Very comfortable stay, no problems,staff very welcoming and informative. Excellent restaurant, so good we ate there two nights,  luggage storage after we checked out. Good location near Parque Bolivar

Excellent A lovely colonial-style building with rooms around a courtyard in a central location just a few blocks away from Plaza de los Ponchos. Some rooms face the street, which offer a window with a view of the street, but are noisier than the interior rooms. The in-house restaurant is excellent with a variety of dishes for most any taste including delicious thin-crust pizzas cooked in a wood-fired oven. The breakfast is excellent and includes tasty coffee or a variety of teas. Filtered water awaits you in your room when you arrive, so there is no need to run out to fill your water bottle after a long day. Friendly and helpful staff. Nice clean rooms. This was my fourth stay in four years. I keep going back since it's one of the nicest places to stay in Otavalo (I've also stayed at two other places in Otavalo, but now this is my favorite). See more
Excellent Great service, friendly staff. Beautiful surroundings

Good A wonderful indigenous host farm family makes you feel welcome in their home. Guests have their own separate quarters and bath. The farm is small but busy and productive, with cows, food crops, pigs, chickens, guinea pigs, dogs, cats, fruit trees and veggies. The views from above Cotacachi are phenomenal. Volcan Imbabura is on one side of the farm and Volcan Cotacachi on the other.

Good This is a great B&B outside Cotacachi in the small town on Tunibamba. Rolando's family was friendly and the food was great. We were served cuy , a national delicacy the first night. If you want to learn and understand more about life in the Sierra, this is the place.

Excellent Sehr schön gelegen, Panoramaaussicht, sehr liebe Familie, man bekommt einen sehr guten Einblick in das Dorfleben. Preis sehr günstig, man muss zwar jedes Mal drei Dollar fürs Taxi bezahlen, um dort weg zu kommen, aber trotzdem noch günstiger als sonstwo. Man kann mit der Familie essen (gut und günstig) und auch auf dem Hof mithelfen. In der Unterkunft selbst hängen Informationen zu Touren aus, die leider gar nicht von der Unterkunft im Internet beworben werden. Hätten wir von den Touren gewusst, wären wir länger geblieben.
Good It's was nice place to stay close to everything you need and the people very friendly!!!!
Excellent
Excellent
Excellent
Excellent
Excellent Perfecto, alojamiento sencillo pero limpio y cómodo, y el servicio muy atento. Desayuno excelente bajo demanda.
Okay

Okay Das Hoottel ist zentral gelegen und bietet 3 Blocks entfernt einen gratis Parkplatz an. Zimmereinrichtung älter aber sauber. Der Safe ist eine festgeschraubte Geldkasette und Schlüssel ist nur gegen Kaution zu bekommen. Eine Fernbedienung gibt es nur auf Verlangen. Frühstück ok aber Extras sind kostenpflichtig. Hotel ist ok aber Leistung eher in 40 USD Kategorie
Okay

Excellent The hotel is lovely but rooms are not air conditioned or heated- not even a ceiling fan. No windows to the street only windows that open towards the hallway so no ventilation. The suites do have windows to the street that will allow for ventilation. The staff went above and beyond fulfilling any and all requests. The hotel is classy in appearance and the neighborhood seemed safe. There is a pharmacy at the corner of the street next to a small bakery. I would stay again but only in a suite- the staff made up any short comings the property had. Also, if you don’t speak Spanish things may get a bit difficult but pls don’t be rude to them. See more
Excellent

Good Fabulous hotel, just wish everything wasn't closed for Carnival. First receptionist spoke some English and was very helpful. The next day the receptionist spoke no English and couldn't even tell us where there might be an open restaurant. Turns out we found a delicious restaurant right in the hotel!

Excellent The reception was very polite  and told us about what there’s to see and how much it was to get to places  room was clean and very quiet   I would recommend to everyone the city was very safe to go out
Excellent
Excellent charming hotel - we would definitely stay there again
Excellent

Good It was pretty, my room was spacious enough, and the premises were clean except for the first room that I was brought to. There were stains on the end table by the bed and the floor was stained, dirty and had hair on it, as was evidenced when I removed my white socks and they were grimy and had to be thrown away. As a recompense, as I was checking out and pressed the matter, they offered me a free dessert, which made me laugh. BUT, the staff generally was professional and pleasant. The hotel restaurant's food was only so so.
Excellent Gracias x el servicio

Excellent The hotel itself is very nice and pleasant. The view from the upper rooms is unbeatable and a big plus is the amazing staff and the great food. I had a great stay and wish I was able to stay longer.
Excellent Awesome service and delicious buffet breakfast. The parking is a lot difficult to access.
Excellent The property was very nice and very close to the center of town where we walked to. Lots of sites to see in the area

Good Great time in Loja.
Very nice city.

Excellent They have quality rooms and the facilities. The staff is amazing and will go out of their way to help

Excellent The staff is amazing. The rooms are luxurious and comfortable. Pool, the sauna and the gym are great. Breakfast is varied and delicious. Best hotel I have stayed in Ecuador
 I will definitely return next time I am in Loja
Excellent It was a great experience!
Okay Location is good. Breakfast is really poor.
Good Nice clean, comfortable room, and excellent value
Okay To much street noise  at night in front rooms
Excellent Great location close to sightseeing, food, shopping with a helpful friendly staff. Comfortable clean rooms with a bath that provides a good hot shower. Well worth the money.

Excellent Everything was perfect. The staff were very nice from the beginning to the end of our journey. The room was impeccable and the breakfast was delicious. Without a doubt, I will book a room in Hotel Podocarpus next time I will be in Loja.
Excellent Great location service was great people were helpfull.
Good Good location. Pleasant staff. Near all places of interest
Good Good service, good location, personal friendly... I’ll be back

Okay The staff was kind enough. The rooms are very dated. They are also very noisy. The bed sleeps like a rack. The bathroom was clumsy and hard to use. The WiFi was almost nonexistent. I had to time it just right just to check my email. We were booked for 5 nights, we left after 2.

Okay The good: The hotel is clean and well maintained. It is centrally located within easy walking distance of shopping, dining and tourist sights in Loja. The breakfast was good. The water was hot enough to shower comfortably after a wait to get warm. The wifi was pretty reliable.  The staff was generally friendly and tried to be helpful. Water dispensers were available in the lobby and on our floor. 
The bad: our room was in the front of the hotel and it was loud even by Ecuadorian standards.  The noise culminated with the police using a loudspeaker to intervene in a domestic situation taking place across the street with a bullhorn at 0200. The beds gave new meaning to "firm".  It was like sleeping on a board with a blanket on top.  They were very uncomfortable.  The staff speaks very little English and with my limited Spanish, it was difficult at times.  To be fair, they were very patient and nice about my language shortcomings. There was a misunderstanding about the number of people in our party. There were 4 instead of the 2 listed on the reservation.  Someone spoke to the other people in the group about some additional charges but it was apparently straightened out. When I checked out there was no mention of it. I assume that it was because the hotel is new to Expedia. See more
Terrible

Excellent Excellent location; walkable. The receptionists were excellent and very helpful. The bell boy Angel was excellent! He did his best to always speak English to us and to help us with maps, etc. Our room was perfect. We had a buffet breakfast which was wonderful. We would definitely stay there again.
Okay
Excellent Great value. We were very pleased with our stay. Would return again and hope to do so very soon.
Excellent
Okay
Good

Excellent El personal que atiende es muy servicial y diligente y la ubicación es muy buena para hacerle turismo.  
Un pequeño detalle: la refrigeradora hace un poco de bulla,  sobre todo en la noche es más notorio.
Good

excelente desayuno.

Excellent Central location, helpful staff, good greakfast, comfortable room, bathtub, hot water

Okay The access to the hotel is very narrow road, to go down into the parking is incredibley steep and to come back up worst, Limited parking space. 
We stayed there 3 different times, the first 2 times they had some kind of parties happening there, and was loud.   No sleep till about 2;30 AM
Last time was okay. 

Staff is friendly and helpful

Good The room was comfortable in line with their star rating. Spacious room but the window shades not dark enough to offset the street  lights. The hotel is very close to a church which makes impossible to get a good night sleep because every hour the church bell goes off.  The area is busy during the day but very quiet at night. The breakfasts is well below average.  Also, hotel has no AC

Excellent Zamorano Real is located in central Loja close to everything, and the facilities are beautifully kept. The best part is the staff who were friendly and welcoming, calling taxis for us, and keeping our luaggage safe for a while after check-out. There was a little street noise around 10-11 but all quieted down after that- the beds and pillows are wonderful, and we slept well. Breakfast was good.
Good Great hotel only disappointment was the dirty carpet

Good The hotel is confortable and quite new. The rooms and the service is nice; however we had a problem with the access: the roads were broken due to cable and pipes instalation all around the hotel. We had to walk two blocks pulling our luggage and park our car six blocks away, that was disgusting because we weren't tell in advance.

Excellent In a country of "good enough", this was a pleasant surprise. A clean, modern hotel with helpful staff. The hotel has its own parking which is a bonus (very tight). I would definitely choose this hotel again

Good After a shaky late Sunday night check in because of a language barrier and a misunderstanding the Zamorano Real was Really a wonderful treat! Clean, comfortable, great location, HOT shower, great staff.... super helpful people, nice breakfast.  One small complaint....the room walls are thin....I can hear and smell the people in the next room.

Excellent

Excellent The hotel is beautiful, a new property but nevertheless with a great history in the vecinity with the old Ambato cotton fabric. Quiet stay and very comfortable bed. The service given by the staff was superb from entry until check out. A place with a fantastic view of the mountains of Ambato and very nice resting spot for the night. Good pressure in the shower for a relaxing time. Recommended.
Excellent Muy bueno el baño limpio
Excellent
Good
Terrible El servicio es malo, la recepcion no es buena. Me quisieron cobrar 2 veces. TERRIBLE
Excellent Si te gusta la naturaleza y conocer culturas y trdiciones, este es el lugar ideal. Alonzo es un anfitrion espectacular y sus historias son increibles!
Excellent

Excellent Foi o melhor lugar que nos hospedamos em toda a viagem ao Equador. Sebastian e Maria são extremamente gentis e hospitaleiros. A casa é linda, muito limpa.Os hospédes não entram com seus calçados, o que favorece ainda mais a limpeza e tem um aroma de eucalipto muito agradável. O quarto é bom, muito espaçoso. Bem localizado, muito perto do Centro, mas em uma área ao mesmo tempo bem tranquila. Voltaria a me hospedar novamente, sem a menor sombra de dúvidas e super indico.
Excellent This friendly, funky, family-run guesthouse offers tremendous value for your money. Conveniently located, generally quiet. I enjoyed hanging out in the deck too.

Excellent From the outside, you might think you made a mistake!  But then you go to the entrance and you see a beautiful eco-hotel.  Saul is an amazing host!  He served ya a delicious breakfast in the morning and then was our tour guide for the day.  He also helped ya fix our tire that someone had let the air out of.   The room we stayed in was spacious and comfortable and “rustic” in a good way.  I highly recommend this place to stay...and suggest you spend more than a day in Baños.

Excellent Hotel is owned by a local family who were all really nice and friendly. Darwin’s dog Pichuca was also really cute! Rooms were big and shower temperature and pressure was good. Breakfast was simple but good and really fresh.

Terrible No privacy in room (window can't be completely blocked with curtain, people walking by, and zero sound proofing, no working wifi.  Never tried hot water, left asap in morning.  But owners were very nice and tried to apologize and accomodate. 1 or 2 extra rooms were under construction(almost done) so could be better in future.
Terrible

Excellent Petit hôtel très mignon, géré par un proprio très attentionné et sympathique qui a vécu de nombreuses années en Suisse avant de revenir en Equateur.
On est baigné dans une atmosphère très familiale, et on a le privilège d'être légèrement décalés de la rue, ce qui limite les nuisances sonores. 
Rencontres avec les autres voyageurs  facilitées grâce à la cuisine commune très pratique, toit terrasse très agréable également.
Petit déjeuner pas mal du tout, avec du très très bon pain !
A noter :
- les chambres paraissent inégales, ne pas hésiter à les visiter pour choisir. 
- pour les excursions, il est préférable de les réserver directement dans les agences afin d'éviter la commission de l'hôtel.See more
Excellent

Excellent Excelente ubicación y atención de Saúl. Muy familiar, buena señal de wifi y tv. Dejamos la sugerencia para modificar mobiliario ya que el espacio disponible es reducido. Buen asesoramiento para actividades a realizar. Imperdible el tour a la selva con Saúl y Germán como guías.
Excellent Excelente la atención y la amabilidad de sus dueños, el desayuno muy fresco y natural, el lugar es bien agradable, regresaría de nuevo :)
Excellent

comentario: Excellent Nice quiet place. A little far from the city center.

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario: Excellent Very clean and comfortable with good shared facilities. Great for a base for a few days!

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario: Okay I don't want to be a bad guy, but I got there and no one was there to greet me.  Possibly there was some kind of confusion or who knows.   But I chose not to stay at their place. and I wish them the best.

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario: Good Require fifteen minutes walking uphill to reach it. Nice layout of room and patio. Only concern too dark while staying in room, not able to read during the night.

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario: Okay Out of the centre of town but closer to one of the thermal baths, bed was comfortable and shower was good, WiFi was good as long as the hostel isn't full. Good idea of energy saving at the hostel. Nice set up for movies. When the hostel is full it can be very noisy, breakfast was nice but economical.

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario: Excellent

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario:
Excellent I don’t know how anyone could rate this place less than excellent...especially considering the awesome staff. Whomever gave negative reviews must be very difficult guests because the staff far exceeded my expectations.

*Clean, economical rooms
*Beer, bottled drinks, wine, even massages in house that you can purchase onsite
*the most helpful staff ever...booked tours for us for way cheaper than we could find on our own, English speaking, and consistently went above and beyond. Helped us avoid missing our flight by explaining the am bus schedule and that we wouldn’t make it to Quito in time. Then she booked a taxi for us (our only option as we had to leave at 3am) and GOT UP AT 3 AM to escort us to the taxi!
*very delicious breakfast that changes everyday. You even have the option to add to it for additional cost. Great, friendly cook.
*Cheap laundry service!

Say here, you won’t regret it. See more

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario: Excellent Great space, friendly staff and and helpful staff. Location out of the way but facilities make up for it.

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B

Okay The staff was kind enough. The rooms are very dated. They are also very noisy. The bed sleeps like a rack. The bathroom was clumsy and hard to use. The WiFi was almost nonexistent. I had to time it just right just to check my email. We were booked for 5 nights, we left after 2.

Okay The good: The hotel is clean and well maintained. It is centrally located within easy walking distance of shopping, dining and tourist sights in Loja. The breakfast was good. The water was hot enough to shower comfortably after a wait to get warm. The wifi was pretty reliable.  The staff was generally friendly and tried to be helpful. Water dispensers were available in the lobby and on our floor. 
The bad: our room was in the front of the hotel and it was loud even by Ecuadorian standards.  The noise culminated with the police using a loudspeaker to intervene in a domestic situation taking place across the street with a bullhorn at 0200. The beds gave new meaning to "firm".  It was like sleeping on a board with a blanket on top.  They were very uncomfortable.  The staff speaks very little English and with my limited Spanish, it was difficult at times.  To be fair, they were very patient and nice about my language shortcomings. There was a misunderstanding about the number of people in our party. There were 4 instead of the 2 listed on the reservation.  Someone spoke to the other people in the group about some additional charges but it was apparently straightened out. When I checked out there was no mention of it. I assume that it was because the hotel is new to Expedia. See more
Terrible

Excellent Excellent location; walkable. The receptionists were excellent and very helpful. The bell boy Angel was excellent! He did his best to always speak English to us and to help us with maps, etc. Our room was perfect. We had a buffet breakfast which was wonderful. We would definitely stay there again.
Okay
Excellent Great value. We were very pleased with our stay. Would return again and hope to do so very soon.
Excellent

Good The room was comfortable in line with their star rating. Spacious room but the window shades not dark enough to offset the street  lights. The hotel is very close to a church which makes impossible to get a good night sleep because every hour the church bell goes off.  The area is busy during the day but very quiet at night. The breakfasts is well below average.  Also, hotel has no AC

Excellent Zamorano Real is located in central Loja close to everything, and the facilities are beautifully kept. The best part is the staff who were friendly and welcoming, calling taxis for us, and keeping our luaggage safe for a while after check-out. There was a little street noise around 10-11 but all quieted down after that- the beds and pillows are wonderful, and we slept well. Breakfast was good.
Good Great hotel only disappointment was the dirty carpet

Good The hotel is confortable and quite new. The rooms and the service is nice; however we had a problem with the access: the roads were broken due to cable and pipes instalation all around the hotel. We had to walk two blocks pulling our luggage and park our car six blocks away, that was disgusting because we weren't tell in advance.

Excellent In a country of "good enough", this was a pleasant surprise. A clean, modern hotel with helpful staff. The hotel has its own parking which is a bonus (very tight). I would definitely choose this hotel again

Excellent The hotel is lovely but rooms are not air conditioned or heated- not even a ceiling fan. No windows to the street only windows that open towards the hallway so no ventilation. The suites do have windows to the street that will allow for ventilation. The staff went above and beyond fulfilling any and all requests. The hotel is classy in appearance and the neighborhood seemed safe. There is a pharmacy at the corner of the street next to a small bakery. I would stay again but only in a suite- the staff made up any short comings the property had. Also, if you don’t speak Spanish things may get a bit difficult but pls don’t be rude to them. See more

Good Fabulous hotel, just wish everything wasn't closed for Carnival. First receptionist spoke some English and was very helpful. As a recompense, as I was checking out and pressed the matter, they offered me a free dessert, which made me laugh. BUT, the staff generally was professional and pleasant. The hotel restaurant's food was only so so.

Excellent Foi o melhor lugar que nos hospedamos em toda a viagem ao Equador. Sebastian e Maria são extremamente gentis e hospitaleiros. A casa é linda, muito limpa.Os hospédes não entram com seus calçados, o que favorece ainda mais a limpeza e tem um aroma de eucalipto muito agradável. O quarto é bom, muito espaçoso. Bem localizado, muito perto do Centro, mas em uma área ao mesmo tempo bem tranquila. Voltaria a me hospedar novamente, sem a menor sombra de dúvidas e super indico.
Excellent This friendly, funky, family-run guesthouse offers tremendous value for your money. Conveniently located, generally quiet. I enjoyed hanging out in the deck too.

Excellent From the outside, you might think you made a mistake!  But then you go to the entrance and you see a beautiful eco-hotel.  Saul is an amazing host!  He served ya a delicious breakfast in the morning and then was our tour guide for the day.  He also helped ya fix our tire that someone had let the air out of.   The room we stayed in was spacious and comfortable and “rustic” in a good way.  I highly recommend this place to stay...and suggest you spend more than a day in Baños.

Excellent Hotel is owned by a local family who were all really nice and friendly. Darwin’s dog Pichuca was also really cute! Rooms were big and shower temperature and pressure was good. Breakfast was simple but good and really fresh.

Terrible No privacy in room (window can't be completely blocked with curtain, people walking by, and zero sound proofing, no working wifi.  Never tried hot water, left asap in morning.  But owners were very nice and tried to apologize and accomodate. 1 or 2 extra rooms were under construction(almost done) so could be better in future.
Terrible

Excellent Petit hôtel très mignon, géré par un proprio très attentionné et sympathique qui a vécu de nombreuses années en Suisse avant de revenir en Equateur.
On est baigné dans une atmosphère très familiale, et on a le privilège d'être légèrement décalés de la rue, ce qui limite les nuisances sonores. 
Rencontres avec les autres voyageurs  facilitées grâce à la cuisine commune très pratique, toit terrasse très agréable également.
Petit déjeuner pas mal du tout, avec du très très bon pain !
A noter :
- les chambres paraissent inégales, ne pas hésiter à les visiter pour choisir. 
- pour les excursions, il est préférable de les réserver directement dans les agences afin d'éviter la commission de l'hôtel.See more
Excellent

Excellent Excelente ubicación y atención de Saúl. Muy familiar, buena señal de wifi y tv. Dejamos la sugerencia para modificar mobiliario ya que el espacio disponible es reducido. Buen asesoramiento para actividades a realizar. Imperdible el tour a la selva con Saúl y Germán como guías.
Excellent Excelente la atención y la amabilidad de sus dueños, el desayuno muy fresco y natural, el lugar es bien agradable, regresaría de nuevo :)

comentario: Okay Out of the centre of town but closer to one of the thermal baths, bed was comfortable and shower was good, WiFi was good as long as the hostel isn't full. nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario:
Excellent I don’t know how anyone could rate this place less than excellent...especially considering the awesome staff. Whomever gave negative reviews must be very difficult guests because the staff far exceeded my expectations.

*Clean, economical rooms
*Beer, bottled drinks, wine, even massages in house that you can purchase onsite
*the most helpful staff ever...booked tours for us for way cheaper than we could find on our own, English speaking, and consistently went above and beyond. Helped us avoid missing our flight by explaining the am bus schedule and that we wouldn’t make it to Quito in time. Then she booked a taxi for us (our only option as we had to leave at 3am) and GOT UP AT 3 AM to escort us to the taxi!
*very delicious breakfast that changes everyday. You even have the option to add to it for additional cost. Great, friendly cook.
*Cheap laundry service!

Say here, you won’t regret it. See more

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario: Excellent Great space, friendly staff and and helpful staff. Location out of the way but facilities make up for it.

Excellent Many hotels in Quito did fancy interiors much better than Sheraton. But if you are looking for a quiet, safe, convenient, and friendly hotel, I definitely recommend Sheraton. I think Sheraton did basic systems much better than other hotels. I believe the good things are not visible, but you can feel them. The room is quiet, and the clothes dry fast...all these mean the construction team might add enough insulation for each demising wall and exterior so I can feel a comfortable environment. Also, the internet is fast. That supports me to work remotely. Sheraton staff are very professional, helpful, and friendly.

nombreh_id: Old Town Quito Suites, Apartments & Boutique hotel
comentario: Excellent This is a beautiful hotel. I highly recommend this to any traveler looking for a bit of relaxation in a busy city. The space is beautifully decorated and very clean. The little touches like fresh bread every morning, stocked fridge and coffee make the space special. The staff and owner, Joz, Edison, Jhon and Dirk, are lovely people and incredibly kind. Very communicate and offer great suggestions where to visit and eat. Next time I visit, I will definitely stay here again.

nombreh_id: Old Town Quito Suites, Apartments & Boutique hotel
comentario: Excellent Yo ha viajado mucho los pasados 20 años. Old Town Quito Hotel es el mejor apartamento que ha tenido. Cada vez que regreso al Quito voy quedar en Oid Town Quito Hotel. Excelente y extrodinario!

comentario: Excellent Spacious well equipped suite with separate living room and kitchen in beautifully restored building next to the historic centre. A very comfortable base for exploring Quito at a reasonable price.

nombreh_id: Old Town Quito Suites, Apartments & Boutique hotel
comentario: Excellent This hotel was perfect for our family of four! The suites are very spacious and well decorated. The staff is extremely nice and helpful. The fridge is stocked every day with breakfast items, which was a very nice touch. There are several restaurants on that street and the heart of old town is just a quick walk away. Amazing place which I highly recommend!

nombreh_id: Old Town Quito Suites, Apartments & Boutique hotel
comentario: Excellent

nombreh_id: Old Town Quito Suites, Apartments & Boutique hotel
comentario: Excellent Stay for a night and it was amazing. The room was spacious and clean. I would definitely stay here again next time visiting Quito.

Good A park next to the hotel has become a youth hang out and tend to stay to early morning hours partying. the hotel upgraded me to a suite away from the park at no extra charge. which my wife are very grateful.
Good Very nice hotel and friendly staff
Good Convenient location for my purposes.

Poor I got a room that faces an area where young people gather at night, drinking, and being loud. I wasn’t able to sleep the entire night.
The room smell like cigarettes smoke, I complained about it. I was told it is a nonsmoking room, and it may be someone on the next room smoking. My problem wasn’t resolved.

Poor The hotel view is spectacular, unfortunately is outdated in term of room amenities. The Internet is rarely working, if so its very slow. Main entrance doors are always locked and only the receptionist can unlock it which I find it inconvenient although there is a security person on site I don't see a need for that.
Good Very nice area and staff very friendly
Good Nice view
Excellent Un lugar mágico y hermoso lo repetiría mil veces, el desayuno riquísimo, la vista asombrosa, todo su personal súper educado y amable, muchas gracias
Excellent

Good Staff at front desk could have been a little more friendly/helpful. Breakfast is included but they serve the same food everyday. Pillows are not the best.  Other than that this is a nice place for the price.
Excellent Beautiful traditional architecture and decor. Very close to the main square and in a very clean area. Breakfast was good.
Good Loved the quiet ambiance. The power outlets are very loose so the connection with our chargers is weak.

Excellent
Excellent This is my second time staying at this hotel and it has been awesome both times.  The staff are so friendly and helpful.

Excellent This refurbished Colonial home with interior courtyard was wonderful for our first trip to Quito. In fact we stayed on the way to the Gallapagos & on the way back. All the staff was very helpful and breakfast of fruit eggs & fresh bread was included. One warning, no elevator, & some rooms are on the 5th or 6th level! The view from the rooftop deck was amazing. They were also very accommodating to change our rooms to the 2nd floor when we asked. I would definitely stay again. The airport transportation was also inexpensive & reliable.See more
Excellent
Excellent Great hotel & location! Nice staff & would stay here again. Highly recommend!

Good The place is awesome. The location is incredible. And the hotel is in good shape. But the service was awful, they offer you a simple breakfast where you are not able to ask for something different than scramble eggs, not even sunny side of or a tortilla. The staff does not show the hotel around and they make it look as it is a place to crush. It is one of the most beautiful places to stay at the center of Quito. But all the crew do not care about it. They don’t even tell you what places can you visit or where to eat since they close their beautiful dinning room for the whole day. It is really sad to see a place with such an amazing potencial to be left like a place to only spend the night. See more
Excellent Nice area of Quito!! Wonderful stay
Excellent Muy bueno!! La atención es excelente.
Good We loved staying at this property. The property staff were exceptional, except for our last day there when we had issues with prepaid airport transfer through the hotel never showed up.

Excellent It's very fancy! This hotel makes one feel right at home with all the amenities necessary for a comfortable experience while traveling. Terrible I tried to cancel an airport pick up 4 days in advance and was declined. Still had to pay $100.00 for a &30.00 cab ride.
Excellent I have stayed at places all over the world. This Hotel is top of the food chain.you can ask them for anything they find away to get it done. This place on all levels is a 10.

Excellent This Hotel is phenomenal. Perfectly located in the heart of Quito historic district. Hotel is fully renovated and staff is very friendly. Food in the restaurant is delicious. Café quiteño experience between 4-6pm at the lobby area is great!

Excellent The stay was incredible! The staff was extremely attentive and helpful. The breakfast and dinner were great, the room was clean and nice and we got a lovey bottle of champagne in our room with a nice card. The garden area in the hotel as well as the roof top view were fantastic.
Good Best place in town

Excellent Everything about our stay was wonderful! Casa Gangotena used to be a mansion and it is beautiful! The service was top notch. Everyone from valet to front desk to the restaurant was sooo nice and helpful. The food at the restaurant we good as well. I know it’s on the pricier side compared to other hotels but if you are looking for a beautiful place to stay with great service look no further.
Excellent Beautiful Colonial and elegant.  Location amazing!! Staff Amazing!! Never said No!!!

Excellent Great staff, friendly and clean..Great location and lovely decor. Highly recommend!

Good Everything was great, the hotel is well located and is very artsy with a little art gallery. Also I found the floor in the room to be a bit dirty and the shower is rather small. Also on Saturday night the music outside the hotel is quite loud until at least 2am. Overall it a great hotel with those small exceptions.
Excellent

Excellent Casa Q was a wonderful escape from reality. We arrived during the protests, so even though the outside world felt chaotic, we felt completely safe and comfortable during our stay there. Excellent The workers were friendly and the place relaxing in many ways.
