Excellent

Excellent Foi o melhor lugar que nos hospedamos em toda a viagem ao Equador. Sebastian e Maria são extremamente gentis e hospitaleiros. A casa é linda, muito limpa.Os hospédes não entram com seus calçados, o que favorece ainda mais a limpeza e tem um aroma de eucalipto muito agradável. O quarto é bom, muito espaçoso. Bem localizado, muito perto do Centro, mas em uma área ao mesmo tempo bem tranquila. Voltaria a me hospedar novamente, sem a menor sombra de dúvidas e super indico.
Excellent This friendly, funky, family-run guesthouse offers tremendous value for your money. Conveniently located, generally quiet. I enjoyed hanging out in the deck too.

Excellent From the outside, you might think you made a mistake!  But then you go to the entrance and you see a beautiful eco-hotel.  Saul is an amazing host!  He served ya a delicious breakfast in the morning and then was our tour guide for the day.  He also helped ya fix our tire that someone had let the air out of.   The room we stayed in was spacious and comfortable and “rustic” in a good way.  I highly recommend this place to stay...and suggest you spend more than a day in Baños.

Excellent Hotel is owned by a local family who were all really nice and friendly. Darwin’s dog Pichuca was also really cute! Rooms were big and shower temperature and pressure was good. Breakfast was simple but good and really fresh.

Terrible No privacy in room (window can't be completely blocked with curtain, people walking by, and zero sound proofing, no working wifi.  Never tried hot water, left asap in morning.  But owners were very nice and tried to apologize and accomodate. 1 or 2 extra rooms were under construction(almost done) so could be better in future.
Terrible

Excellent Petit hôtel très mignon, géré par un proprio très attentionné et sympathique qui a vécu de nombreuses années en Suisse avant de revenir en Equateur.
On est baigné dans une atmosphère très familiale, et on a le privilège d'être légèrement décalés de la rue, ce qui limite les nuisances sonores. 
Rencontres avec les autres voyageurs  facilitées grâce à la cuisine commune très pratique, toit terrasse très agréable également.
Petit déjeuner pas mal du tout, avec du très très bon pain !
A noter :
- les chambres paraissent inégales, ne pas hésiter à les visiter pour choisir. 
- pour les excursions, il est préférable de les réserver directement dans les agences afin d'éviter la commission de l'hôtel.See more
Excellent

Excellent Excelente ubicación y atención de Saúl. Muy familiar, buena señal de wifi y tv. Dejamos la sugerencia para modificar mobiliario ya que el espacio disponible es reducido. Buen asesoramiento para actividades a realizar. Imperdible el tour a la selva con Saúl y Germán como guías.
Excellent Excelente la atención y la amabilidad de sus dueños, el desayuno muy fresco y natural, el lugar es bien agradable, regresaría de nuevo :)
Excellent

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario: Okay I don't want to be a bad guy, but I got there and no one was there to greet me.  Possibly there was some kind of confusion or who knows.   But I chose not to stay at their place. and I wish them the best.

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario: Good Require fifteen minutes walking uphill to reach it. Nice layout of room and patio. Only concern too dark while staying in room, not able to read during the night.

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario: Okay Out of the centre of town but closer to one of the thermal baths, bed was comfortable and shower was good, WiFi was good as long as the hostel isn't full. Good idea of energy saving at the hostel. Nice set up for movies. When the hostel is full it can be very noisy, breakfast was nice but economical.

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario: Excellent

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario:
Excellent I don’t know how anyone could rate this place less than excellent...especially considering the awesome staff. Whomever gave negative reviews must be very difficult guests because the staff far exceeded my expectations.

*Clean, economical rooms
*Beer, bottled drinks, wine, even massages in house that you can purchase onsite
*the most helpful staff ever...booked tours for us for way cheaper than we could find on our own, English speaking, and consistently went above and beyond. Helped us avoid missing our flight by explaining the am bus schedule and that we wouldn’t make it to Quito in time. Then she booked a taxi for us (our only option as we had to leave at 3am) and GOT UP AT 3 AM to escort us to the taxi!
*very delicious breakfast that changes everyday. You even have the option to add to it for additional cost. Great, friendly cook.
*Cheap laundry service!

Say here, you won’t regret it. See more

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario: Excellent Great space, friendly staff and and helpful staff. Location out of the way but facilities make up for it.

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B

The hotel is classy in appearance and the neighborhood seemed safe. There is a pharmacy at the corner of the street next to a small bakery. I would stay again but only in a suite- the staff made up any short comings the property had. Also, if you don’t speak Spanish things may get a bit difficult but pls don’t be rude to them. See more

A casa é linda, muito limpa.Os hospédes não entram com seus calçados, o que favorece ainda mais a limpeza e tem um aroma de eucalipto muito agradável. O quarto é bom, muito espaçoso. Bem localizado, muito perto do Centro, mas em uma área ao mesmo tempo bem tranquila. Voltaria a me hospedar novamente, sem a menor sombra de dúvidas e super indico.
Excellent This friendly, funky, family-run guesthouse offers tremendous value for your money. Conveniently located, generally quiet. I enjoyed hanging out in the deck too.

Excellent From the outside, you might think you made a mistake!  But then you go to the entrance and you see a beautiful eco-hotel.  Saul is an amazing host!  He served ya a delicious breakfast in the morning and then was our tour guide for the day.  He also helped ya fix our tire that someone had let the air out of.   The room we stayed in was spacious and comfortable and “rustic” in a good way.  I highly recommend this place to stay...and suggest you spend more than a day in Baños.

Excellent Hotel is owned by a local family who were all really nice and friendly. Darwin’s dog Pichuca was also really cute! Rooms were big and shower temperature and pressure was good. Breakfast was simple but good and really fresh.

Terrible No privacy in room (window can't be completely blocked with curtain, people walking by, and zero sound proofing, no working wifi.  Never tried hot water, left asap in morning.  But owners were very nice and tried to apologize and accomodate. 1 or 2 extra rooms were under construction(almost done) so could be better in future.
Terrible

Excellent Petit hôtel très mignon, géré par un proprio très attentionné et sympathique qui a vécu de nombreuses années en Suisse avant de revenir en Equateur.
On est baigné dans une atmosphère très familiale, et on a le privilège d'être légèrement décalés de la rue, ce qui limite les nuisances sonores. 
Rencontres avec les autres voyageurs  facilitées grâce à la cuisine commune très pratique, toit terrasse très agréable également.
Petit déjeuner pas mal du tout, avec du très très bon pain !
A noter :
- les chambres paraissent inégales, ne pas hésiter à les visiter pour choisir. 
- pour les excursions, il est préférable de les réserver directement dans les agences afin d'éviter la commission de l'hôtel.See more

Excellent Excelente la atención y la amabilidad de sus dueños, el desayuno muy fresco y natural, el lugar es bien agradable, regresaría de nuevo :)

comentario:
Excellent I don’t know how anyone could rate this place less than excellent...especially considering the awesome staff. Whomever gave negative reviews must be very difficult guests because the staff far exceeded my expectations.

*Clean, economical rooms
*Beer, bottled drinks, wine, even massages in house that you can purchase onsite
*the most helpful staff ever...booked tours for us for way cheaper than we could find on our own, English speaking, and consistently went above and beyond. Helped us avoid missing our flight by explaining the am bus schedule and that we wouldn’t make it to Quito in time. Then she booked a taxi for us (our only option as we had to leave at 3am) and GOT UP AT 3 AM to escort us to the taxi!
*very delicious breakfast that changes everyday. You even have the option to add to it for additional cost. Great, friendly cook.
*Cheap laundry service!

Say here, you won’t regret it. See more

nombreh_id: Old Town Quito Suites, Apartments & Boutique hotel
comentario: Excellent This is a beautiful hotel. I highly recommend this to any traveler looking for a bit of relaxation in a busy city. The space is beautifully decorated and very clean. The little touches like fresh bread every morning, stocked fridge and coffee make the space special. The staff and owner, Joz, Edison, Jhon and Dirk, are lovely people and incredibly kind. Very communicate and offer great suggestions where to visit and eat. Next time I visit, I will definitely stay here again.

Okay The good: The hotel is clean and well maintained. It is centrally located within easy walking distance of shopping, dining and tourist sights in Loja. The breakfast was good. The water was hot enough to shower comfortably after a wait to get warm. The wifi was pretty reliable.  The staff was generally friendly and tried to be helpful. Water dispensers were available in the lobby and on our floor. 
The bad: our room was in the front of the hotel and it was loud even by Ecuadorian standards.  The noise culminated with the police using a loudspeaker to intervene in a domestic situation taking place across the street with a bullhorn at 0200. The beds gave new meaning to "firm".  It was like sleeping on a board with a blanket on top.  They were very uncomfortable.  The staff speaks very little English and with my limited Spanish, it was difficult at times.  To be fair, they were very patient and nice about my language shortcomings. There was a misunderstanding about the number of people in our party. There were 4 instead of the 2 listed on the reservation.  Someone spoke to the other people in the group about some additional charges but it was apparently straightened out. When I checked out there was no mention of it. I assume that it was because the hotel is new to Expedia. See more
Terrible

Excellent Excellent location; walkable. The receptionists were excellent and very helpful. The bell boy Angel was excellent! He did his best to always speak English to us and to help us with maps, etc. Our room was perfect. We had a buffet breakfast which was wonderful. We would definitely stay there again.

Good The room was comfortable in line with their star rating. Spacious room but the window shades not dark enough to offset the street  lights. The breakfasts is well below average.  Also, hotel has no AC

Excellent Zamorano Real is located in central Loja close to everything, and the facilities are beautifully kept. The best part is the staff who were friendly and welcoming, calling taxis for us, and keeping our luaggage safe for a while after check-out. There was a little street noise around 10-11 but all quieted down after that- the beds and pillows are wonderful, and we slept well. Breakfast was good.
Good Great hotel only disappointment was the dirty carpet

Good The hotel is confortable and quite new. The rooms and the service is nice; however we had a problem with the access: the roads were broken due to cable and pipes instalation all around the hotel. We had to walk two blocks pulling our luggage and park our car six blocks away, that was disgusting because we weren't tell in advance.

Excellent In a country of "good enough", this was a pleasant surprise. A clean, modern hotel with helpful staff. The hotel has its own parking which is a bonus (very tight). I would definitely choose this hotel again

Excellent The hotel is beautiful, a new property but nevertheless with a great history in the vecinity with the old Ambato cotton fabric. Quiet stay and very comfortable bed. Good pressure in the shower for a relaxing time. Recommended.

Excellent Si te gusta la naturaleza y conocer culturas y trdiciones, este es el lugar ideal. Alonzo es un anfitrion espectacular y sus historias son increibles!
Excellent

Excellent Foi o melhor lugar que nos hospedamos em toda a viagem ao Equador. Sebastian e Maria são extremamente gentis e hospitaleiros. A casa é linda, muito limpa.Os hospédes não entram com seus calçados, o que favorece ainda mais a limpeza e tem um aroma de eucalipto muito agradável. O quarto é bom, muito espaçoso. Bem localizado, muito perto do Centro, mas em uma área ao mesmo tempo bem tranquila. Voltaria a me hospedar novamente, sem a menor sombra de dúvidas e super indico.
Excellent This friendly, funky, family-run guesthouse offers tremendous value for your money. Conveniently located, generally quiet. I enjoyed hanging out in the deck too.

Excellent From the outside, you might think you made a mistake!  But then you go to the entrance and you see a beautiful eco-hotel.  Saul is an amazing host!  He served ya a delicious breakfast in the morning and then was our tour guide for the day.  He also helped ya fix our tire that someone had let the air out of.   The room we stayed in was spacious and comfortable and “rustic” in a good way.  I highly recommend this place to stay...and suggest you spend more than a day in Baños.

Excellent Hotel is owned by a local family who were all really nice and friendly. Darwin’s dog Pichuca was also really cute! Rooms were big and shower temperature and pressure was good. Breakfast was simple but good and really fresh.

Terrible No privacy in room (window can't be completely blocked with curtain, people walking by, and zero sound proofing, no working wifi.  Never tried hot water, left asap in morning.  But owners were very nice and tried to apologize and accomodate. 1 or 2 extra rooms were under construction(almost done) so could be better in future.
Terrible

Excellent Petit hôtel très mignon, géré par un proprio très attentionné et sympathique qui a vécu de nombreuses années en Suisse avant de revenir en Equateur.
On est baigné dans une atmosphère très familiale, et on a le privilège d'être légèrement décalés de la rue, ce qui limite les nuisances sonores. 
Rencontres avec les autres voyageurs  facilitées grâce à la cuisine commune très pratique, toit terrasse très agréable également.
Petit déjeuner pas mal du tout, avec du très très bon pain !
A noter :
- les chambres paraissent inégales, ne pas hésiter à les visiter pour choisir. 
- pour les excursions, il est préférable de les réserver directement dans les agences afin d'éviter la commission de l'hôtel.See more
Excellent

Excellent Excelente ubicación y atención de Saúl. Muy familiar, buena señal de wifi y tv. Dejamos la sugerencia para modificar mobiliario ya que el espacio disponible es reducido. Buen asesoramiento para actividades a realizar. Imperdible el tour a la selva con Saúl y Germán como guías.
Excellent Excelente la atención y la amabilidad de sus dueños, el desayuno muy fresco y natural, el lugar es bien agradable, regresaría de nuevo :)
Excellent

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario: Excellent Very clean and comfortable with good shared facilities. Great for a base for a few days!

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario: Okay I don't want to be a bad guy, but I got there and no one was there to greet me.  Possibly there was some kind of confusion or who knows.   But I chose not to stay at their place. and I wish them the best.

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario: Good Require fifteen minutes walking uphill to reach it. Nice layout of room and patio. Only concern too dark while staying in room, not able to read during the night.

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario: Okay Out of the centre of town but closer to one of the thermal baths, bed was comfortable and shower was good, WiFi was good as long as the hostel isn't full. Good idea of energy saving at the hostel. Nice set up for movies. When the hostel is full it can be very noisy, breakfast was nice but economical.

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario: Excellent

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario:
Excellent I don’t know how anyone could rate this place less than excellent...especially considering the awesome staff. Whomever gave negative reviews must be very difficult guests because the staff far exceeded my expectations.

*Clean, economical rooms
*Beer, bottled drinks, wine, even massages in house that you can purchase onsite
*the most helpful staff ever...booked tours for us for way cheaper than we could find on our own, English speaking, and consistently went above and beyond. Helped us avoid missing our flight by explaining the am bus schedule and that we wouldn’t make it to Quito in time. Then she booked a taxi for us (our only option as we had to leave at 3am) and GOT UP AT 3 AM to escort us to the taxi!
*very delicious breakfast that changes everyday. You even have the option to add to it for additional cost. Great, friendly cook.
*Cheap laundry service!

Say here, you won’t regret it. See more

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario: Excellent Great space, friendly staff and and helpful staff. Location out of the way but facilities make up for it.

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B

As a recompense, as I was checking out and pressed the matter, they offered me a free dessert, which made me laugh. BUT, the staff generally was professional and pleasant. The hotel restaurant's food was only so so.

Okay The staff was kind enough. The rooms are very dated. They are also very noisy. The bed sleeps like a rack. The bathroom was clumsy and hard to use. The WiFi was almost nonexistent. I had to time it just right just to check my email. We were booked for 5 nights, we left after 2.

Okay The good: The hotel is clean and well maintained. It is centrally located within easy walking distance of shopping, dining and tourist sights in Loja. The breakfast was good. The water was hot enough to shower comfortably after a wait to get warm. The wifi was pretty reliable.  The staff was generally friendly and tried to be helpful. Water dispensers were available in the lobby and on our floor. 
The bad: our room was in the front of the hotel and it was loud even by Ecuadorian standards.  The noise culminated with the police using a loudspeaker to intervene in a domestic situation taking place across the street with a bullhorn at 0200. The beds gave new meaning to "firm".  It was like sleeping on a board with a blanket on top.  They were very uncomfortable.  The staff speaks very little English and with my limited Spanish, it was difficult at times.  To be fair, they were very patient and nice about my language shortcomings. There was a misunderstanding about the number of people in our party. There were 4 instead of the 2 listed on the reservation.  Someone spoke to the other people in the group about some additional charges but it was apparently straightened out. When I checked out there was no mention of it. I assume that it was because the hotel is new to Expedia. See more
Terrible

Excellent Excellent location; walkable. The receptionists were excellent and very helpful. The bell boy Angel was excellent! He did his best to always speak English to us and to help us with maps, etc. Our room was perfect. We had a buffet breakfast which was wonderful. We would definitely stay there again.
Okay

Excellent Zamorano Real is located in central Loja close to everything, and the facilities are beautifully kept. The best part is the staff who were friendly and welcoming, calling taxis for us, and keeping our luaggage safe for a while after check-out. Excellent In a country of "good enough", this was a pleasant surprise. A clean, modern hotel with helpful staff. The hotel has its own parking which is a bonus (very tight). I would definitely choose this hotel again

Excellent Foi o melhor lugar que nos hospedamos em toda a viagem ao Equador. Sebastian e Maria são extremamente gentis e hospitaleiros. A casa é linda, muito limpa.Os hospédes não entram com seus calçados, o que favorece ainda mais a limpeza e tem um aroma de eucalipto muito agradável. O quarto é bom, muito espaçoso. Bem localizado, muito perto do Centro, mas em uma área ao mesmo tempo bem tranquila. Voltaria a me hospedar novamente, sem a menor sombra de dúvidas e super indico.
Excellent This friendly, funky, family-run guesthouse offers tremendous value for your money. Conveniently located, generally quiet. I enjoyed hanging out in the deck too.

Excellent From the outside, you might think you made a mistake!  But then you go to the entrance and you see a beautiful eco-hotel.  Saul is an amazing host!  He served ya a delicious breakfast in the morning and then was our tour guide for the day.  He also helped ya fix our tire that someone had let the air out of.   The room we stayed in was spacious and comfortable and “rustic” in a good way.  I highly recommend this place to stay...and suggest you spend more than a day in Baños.

Excellent Hotel is owned by a local family who were all really nice and friendly. Darwin’s dog Pichuca was also really cute! Rooms were big and shower temperature and pressure was good. Breakfast was simple but good and really fresh.

Terrible No privacy in room (window can't be completely blocked with curtain, people walking by, and zero sound proofing, no working wifi.  Never tried hot water, left asap in morning.  But owners were very nice and tried to apologize and accomodate. 1 or 2 extra rooms were under construction(almost done) so could be better in future.
Terrible

Excellent Petit hôtel très mignon, géré par un proprio très attentionné et sympathique qui a vécu de nombreuses années en Suisse avant de revenir en Equateur.
On est baigné dans une atmosphère très familiale, et on a le privilège d'être légèrement décalés de la rue, ce qui limite les nuisances sonores. 
Rencontres avec les autres voyageurs  facilitées grâce à la cuisine commune très pratique, toit terrasse très agréable également.
Petit déjeuner pas mal du tout, avec du très très bon pain !
A noter :
- les chambres paraissent inégales, ne pas hésiter à les visiter pour choisir. 
- pour les excursions, il est préférable de les réserver directement dans les agences afin d'éviter la commission de l'hôtel.See more
Excellent

comentario:
Excellent I don’t know how anyone could rate this place less than excellent...especially considering the awesome staff. Whomever gave negative reviews must be very difficult guests because the staff far exceeded my expectations.

*Clean, economical rooms
*Beer, bottled drinks, wine, even massages in house that you can purchase onsite
*the most helpful staff ever...booked tours for us for way cheaper than we could find on our own, English speaking, and consistently went above and beyond. Helped us avoid missing our flight by explaining the am bus schedule and that we wouldn’t make it to Quito in time. Then she booked a taxi for us (our only option as we had to leave at 3am) and GOT UP AT 3 AM to escort us to the taxi!
*very delicious breakfast that changes everyday. You even have the option to add to it for additional cost. Great, friendly cook.
*Cheap laundry service!

Say here, you won’t regret it. See more

nombreh_id: La Casa del Molino Blanco B&B
comentario: Excellent Great space, friendly staff and and helpful staff. Location out of the way but facilities make up for it.

nombreh_id: Old Town Quito Suites, Apartments & Boutique hotel
comentario: Excellent This is a beautiful hotel. I highly recommend this to any traveler looking for a bit of relaxation in a busy city. The space is beautifully decorated and very clean. The little touches like fresh bread every morning, stocked fridge and coffee make the space special. The staff and owner, Joz, Edison, Jhon and Dirk, are lovely people and incredibly kind. Very communicate and offer great suggestions where to visit and eat. Next time I visit, I will definitely stay here again.

comentario: Excellent Yo ha viajado mucho los pasados 20 años. Old Town Quito Hotel es el mejor apartamento que ha tenido. Cada vez que regreso al Quito voy quedar en Oid Town Quito Hotel. Excelente y extrodinario!

Good Everything was great, the hotel is well located and is very artsy with a little art gallery. Also I found the floor in the room to be a bit dirty and the shower is rather small. Also on Saturday night the music outside the hotel is quite loud until at least 2am. Overall it a great hotel with those small exceptions.

In addition to the hotel being gorgeous, the staff there were so kind, helpful, and informative! Would highly recommend and would stay there again!

Okay Hacienda Chorlavi used to be one of the best locations to stay in Ibarra. Not anymore. The hotel is very well located on the Panamericana Highway, 5 minutes South to the city entrance. Rooms have been upgraded recently with new bathrooms, TVs and Internet. All this is good. But the rest of the hotel is getting old and service is not top level. Overall not worth the extra bucks you pay compared to other options in Ibarra.
Excellent Perfect weekend getaway! The room was beautiful and cozy, and the food and activities were great.

Excellent What a beautiful and relaxing place. There's an excellent staff, a tasty restaurant on site, and many things to do if your decide to hang out on the grounds.  It was a very romantic setting with incredible attention to detail. The gardens are amazing. The room was comfortable. They built a fire each night in our room and provided cool hot water bottles to go under the blankets at night, though we never found it particularly cold when we went in October.

But seriously, with Cerro Imbabura rising majestically on one side, and the tranquil waters of Lago San Pablo on the other, it's hard to ask for more. Just don't get too worried as you drive through a very common Ecuadorian neighborhood on the way there. You may think, "where am I going?" But once you arrive, you'll feel like you found a piece of heaven. I sure did!See more

Excellent It’s a magical place. I had this beautiful cabin right in front of the lake. Gorgeous view, gorgeous room. 
Food is delicious. 
I don’t like they don’t have phones or any other way in the rooms to call for room service so if you need something you have to walk to the reception and at night it is very cold. So that’s the only thing I did not like. Other that that the place is absolutely amazing.

The rooms are beautiful and loved the fireplace! My only negative was that the workers started sawing right outside our room at 7 AM. To me, when people come on vacation they want to sleep in, not be awoken that early. I did speak with reception and they were super apologetic and stopped immediately.

Thoroughly enoyed the fireplaces for cool mornings/evenings in the restaurant, drawing room, and our room. Service was excellent. The horseback ride with Ubertero was a highlight of our stay. A great place to stay in the Otovalo area.

Okay This Hacienda is very beautiful and well-maintained but the room wasn’t good. The room needed a lot of upgrades the bathroom was totally outdated. There was no hot water.  I really enjoyed the garden so it’s worth to stay only one night to enjoy the surrounding and the garden but the room was very disappointing. It needed major renovation. The bathroom looked like a one star motel’s bathroom. Also do not book any activity with them, They overcharge terribly and it’s a total rip off. For example hire a taxi and ask the driver to wait when you finish your hike, it costed me $30 versus $120 that the Hacienda charges. See more

Excellent Definitely one of the most beautiful places to stay in Ibarra. It is located in the countryside, just 5 min drive from downtown Ibarra, with unique views. Doreen and Carlos are excellent hosts and gave us lots of tips for travelling around. Breakfast is delicious, everything is fresh and organic from their own gardens. HIghly recommended for travellers who wish to experience the real Ecuador.
Excellent Bird watching during breakfast, specially hummingbirds, is a treat. Also I really liked the convenience of being able to have a good dinner at the hotel. Food was well prepared.
Excellent Close proximity to Quito ... lots to do and see in Ibarra. Lots to see on the way as well.

Good I personally dislike cold places, we stayed first on Hosteria Estelita, and although it has a nice view I could not sleep because place is on the mountain and is super cold, but Hysteria Canavalle is located in a place with a great temperature
Good Friendly staff ready to help...  I went to a competition and location was perfect as it is near Ibarra.

Excellent OUTSTANDING! This was a perfect place for our stay in Ecuador. We were interested in educating ourselves more about the Ecuadorian culture, the environment, the lifestyle and the future of this community. Carlos and Doreen are wonderful hosts, (they both speak English and Spanish) but they also are educators for their guests and their community. The facilities are the cleanest we have stayed in, consistent on demand hot water, wonderful continental breakfast, large rooms, quiet environment, friendly and helpful staff, wonderful views of the surrounding mountains, family oriented (games, soccer, badminton, lamas, horses ) and owners that will assist you with arranging local attractions.See more
Excellent The owners are wonderful and the home cooking was delicious. The place is nicely tucked away from the town and was just a pure pleasure to be there amongst nature in an Eco-friendly resort.

Good The accommodations that we had were for 3 people and were in the older part of the building. The rooms were clean and adequate but not fancy. What makes this property special are the staff. Everyone was so kind and helpful. They organized our transportation from Quito airport and were happy to do some much needed laundry for us. The owner was very helpful in his suggestions on what to do in the town.
The inner courtyard was a lovely space to enjoy the very tasty breakfast (best juice we had in Ecuador!). There was minimal street noise despite it's central location. We would not hesitate to stay there again. It was great value for money!See more

Excellent Amazing place! Great location, but very quiet if you get a room garden side. Freddy is absolutely fabulous and helpful. He drove me to the safe parking up the ride and gave me rides back. Breakfast was great too, with a new juice everyday. Totally recommend this place!

Excellent We loved this hotel. Freddie is absolutely fabulous. Very friendly and drove me to an secured off site parking. The room was very spacious and clean. The breakfast was Lovely too and the location is perfect. I would highly recommend.

Excellent We were only supposed to stay in Otavalo for one night, but a mishap with not getting our rental car forced us to change our plans drastically and we ended up staying here for 4 nights. We were honestly very happy that it happened.
The hostel is very well taken care of. The owner does speak English, the rest of the staff speaks little but they were all very helpful and attentive.
Breakfast each morning was bread/butter/jam, juice, eggs and coffee. The location is great, very close to the town square and the daily markets. The garden area inside was gorgeous. We were even able to have our laundry done. The owner also has a trusted contact for longer drives outside of the city if needed. We utilized this for an afternoon hike and a visit to Cotocachi (which is a must if you are in this area).

Overall, this is a wonderful hostel in Otavalo with friendly staff, a convenient location, and a great atmosphere.See more

Good Hotel with endless charm and character, people running it are amazing, helpful, kept our luggage until the following night, so we could enjoy Otavalo until we had to catch our late night flight. 
Like most of the historic hotels it gets cold at night and the bathrooms are functioning at varying degrees, but the shower was hot.
Excellent It's a great hotel in a perfect location. The staff could not have been nicer!
Good Comfortable and quiet facility within a few blocks of the markets. Day staff usually spoke English and could help you with your interests.
Excellent Great staff and the owners were very friendly and informative. Staff went out of way to assist us. Great breakfast.
Excellent Lovely spot, close to the market.The staff was extremely helpful.  Really enjoyed our stay!
Good Very small hotel but nice location. The only complaint we had was there was a dog that barked almost all night and kept us awake! It’s quite open aired so we heard every noise.
Excellent The staff is amazing. The location is excellent. The food was unbelievable and totally delicious.
Good Lovely historic hotel.   Great location.  Very good restaurant.  Helpful staff.

Good This place is right in the middle of the town, walking distance to the famous Saturday market, close to restaurants, very nice and helpful staff, the room is basic nothing fancy but very clean and there’s hot water, very good breakfast. I highly recommend this place especially for mid budget.

Good Property is mostly charming and the staff is fantastic-Lucy, Vladamir and the rest were great.  Property is a little downtrodden however and we felt quite expensive for Ecuador.  Parking costs $4 per day but they charge extra for additional hours.  Cleanliness could be improved but not bad overall.  Food is good especially pizza and breakfast. Location is great right next to the market.  We ended up paying about $50 per night with the parking added in.  Should be no more than $35

Excellent Very comfortable stay, no problems,staff very welcoming and informative. Excellent restaurant, so good we ate there two nights,  luggage storage after we checked out. Good location near Parque Bolivar

Excellent A lovely colonial-style building with rooms around a courtyard in a central location just a few blocks away from Plaza de los Ponchos. Some rooms face the street, which offer a window with a view of the street, but are noisier than the interior rooms. The in-house restaurant is excellent with a variety of dishes for most any taste including delicious thin-crust pizzas cooked in a wood-fired oven. The breakfast is excellent and includes tasty coffee or a variety of teas. Filtered water awaits you in your room when you arrive, so there is no need to run out to fill your water bottle after a long day. Friendly and helpful staff. Nice clean rooms. This was my fourth stay in four years. I keep going back since it's one of the nicest places to stay in Otavalo (I've also stayed at two other places in Otavalo, but now this is my favorite). See more
Excellent Great service, friendly staff. Beautiful surroundings

Good A wonderful indigenous host farm family makes you feel welcome in their home. Guests have their own separate quarters and bath. The farm is small but busy and productive, with cows, food crops, pigs, chickens, guinea pigs, dogs, cats, fruit trees and veggies. The views from above Cotacachi are phenomenal. Volcan Imbabura is on one side of the farm and Volcan Cotacachi on the other.

Good This is a great B&B outside Cotacachi in the small town on Tunibamba. Rolando's family was friendly and the food was great. We were served cuy , a national delicacy the first night. If you want to learn and understand more about life in the Sierra, this is the place.

Excellent Sehr schön gelegen, Panoramaaussicht, sehr liebe Familie, man bekommt einen sehr guten Einblick in das Dorfleben. Man kann mit der Familie essen (gut und günstig) und auch auf dem Hof mithelfen. In der Unterkunft selbst hängen Informationen zu Touren aus, die leider gar nicht von der Unterkunft im Internet beworben werden. Hätten wir von den Touren gewusst, wären wir länger geblieben.

Good Good location. The restaurant is very good, with a good offering and great attention.
Good Good place for Stay

Poor I used to stay at this hotel and always had a good experience. Well located and quality of service. But in this last stay I was disappointed to see that the quality has been reduced and it’s no longer competing with other high level hotels in Manta. They need to renew the facilities to keep up. Will probably stay somewhere else next time.

Excellent Very nice and clean hotel. The staff were all friendly and helpful. The room was very clean, and had everything you would expect from any other hotel. My only gripe, and it is a very minor gripe, is that the restaurant only serves food during certain meal times. But they are close enough to many other good places to eat, so it really wanst a big deal. I was still able to get a delicious Mojito with fresh mint from the garden. And when I was able to eat at the restaurant for Bfast, and 1 dinner the food was excellent. Also, some of the better shopping for local handmade goods is less than a block away right out the front door and down the hill a little. Overall I enjoyed my stay, and I plan to stay at Perla Spondylus again the next time I visit Manta.See more
Good
Good When the pool is finished this property will be excellent!
Excellent The staff is very professional and accommodating. The hotel is centrally located.

Excellent I am extremely happy with this hotel and its staff. They are very professional and friendly. Attention is great, facilities are mint and the prices are fair. I am certainly looking forward to stay at this hotel on my next visit and I strongly recommend it to anyone visiting Manta.

Excellent Hotel is a $5 taxi ride from airport which takes about 20 minutes. 
Hotel is on a quite street walking distance to beach and tourist areas bars and restaurants. 
Area seemed very safe at night, we had no issues or at anytime felt unsafe walking day or night.

On arrival to our Hotel we was greeted by English speaking staff and given a free upgrade. 
When it comes to customer service I can’t remember staying anywhere better, staff are very attentive and genuinely concerned our stay in their hotel was what we expected. 
If Spanish speaking staff did not understand what we wanted either at front desk or in the restaurant they would go and get someone that spoke English to translate. 
Breakfast in hotel restaurant was very good, with a choice of about 6-7 different country style of breakfast. 
We had fruit, eggs and pancakes which was awesome and set you up for a good start to the day. 
Dinner menu also had a good choice and was very good quality food. 

Overall the hotel was very good in a great loacation and amazing staff who wanted us to have the best stay in their hotel. 

I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel or to stay here again should I return to Manta, Ecuador. 


See more

Excellent Recent modern hotel just  a short taxi drive to city points of interests.
A very attentive and caring staff, something rare nowadays in hotels (Thank you again Maria for everything).
Only thing missing is a swimming pool.

overall it was an ok experience but could had been a lot better if they had more selection on drinks and food.

Excellent Friendly service, comfortable rooms and great food.

Poor They gave us a dirty room that was only partially renovated and lacked basic things like blinds for the window. The room wasn't just dirty, it had been slept in and someone just made the bed up but it was full of hair from the previous guest. The blindless window opened to a hallway with a very bright motion sensor LED. Really bad experience the first night. They made up slightly the other nights. Staff was friendly, but management clearly not on top of their game. Area was cool, nice beach.
Okay Very reasonable for the price and the condition  of the hotel steps from the beach that's  always a plus.....overall ok.

Excellent Soga Hostal is about a 1 minute walk from a beautiful beach.  The breakfast was great and the dinner we had was excellent.  Warm welcome, beautiful common areas including a digital nomad space, a guest "bar" that seemed to open early and close late, quiet location, good security, and basic rooms.

Excellent I traveled all over Ecuador and stayed in six different hotels. By far, Soga Hostal was the best! My room had a spectacular ocean view, it was clean and had hot water, which some other hotels didn't have, The staff is friendly and helpful, and the manager speaks fluent English, which was very helpful for me. The food was great, too!
Excellent Great stay at a great place with great customer service!  I guess everything was just great!
Excellent The staff were super nice.  Breakfast was great and got Netflix on TV which is awesome!!  The beach was so close & peaceful.

Excellent Kimberly and her staff were very attentive and treated us and our 2 dogs like family.

Excellent The property is beautifully maintained in a small fishing village with great character.  The owner and staff make you feel at home once you walk through the gates.  First to time to Ecuador and it will not be our last to this unique hotel.   You can hear the Ocean all day and night from every room and it is only footsteps away.  Awesome place and hospitality and some cold beer and cool sunsets.   There is good wifi but leave your D^%n phone in the room.

Excellent Nicest place in area. Very friendly and welcoming owner and staff. We felt like family. Went out of their way to ensure a great experience.

Excellent Kimberly and her staff are absolutely wonderful! They took care of all of our needs and made sure our stay was perfect! We felt like family. The location is perfect -- on the beach and close to everything! We loved our stay so much, we have aleady made plans to return!

Okay This was our first stop after flying to Manta on the coast of Ecuador.  It was right in the middle of the country's carnival which made the town very congested and noisy.  When we arrived and asked for confirmation of the free breakfast, we were told it wasn't included.  However, upon showing the written confirmation, the owner agreed.  Although they do not appear to be well set up for providing breakfasts, the staff did put together a good breakfast for us.  I think if we had purchased one of their larger rooms our experience might have been a lot better, but they were full on the night of arrival.  The room we had was very small, and although it had all the features mentioned below, it did not meet our needs so we left after the first night even though we were paid for three nights.  We drove to a different town with a nicer beach and stayed there for three nights.  Even though the new place cost a bit more and had none of the features listed below under "...likes...", we found it much better than Cottages by the Sea because it was spacious, airy, well-lit, modern, very clean, had lots of hooks & hangers and places to put our bags and things, had two multi-speed fans in each room and had an immaculate, bright bathroom with high-end fixtures.See more
Excellent Un lugar muy acogedor, limpio y ordenando con una excelente atención, seguro regresamos en una próxima ocasión

Excellent Since moving to Ecuador we have stayed at this hotel many times. Our stays are always perfect! The staff is very accommodating and provides services equal to 5 star hotels in the US. The rooms are very comfortable with amenities such as robes, slippers, multiple toiletry items and 24 hour room service. The resturant menu and breakfast buffet are excellent as well as providing superb wait staff. The hotel also provides 24 hour airport drop off and pick up. I’ve made reservations for pickups weeks in advance and they are always there when I exit the airport; even when our flight is delayed by hours and we arrive at wee hours of the morning. I have recommended this hotel to many friends who visit and need a place to stay before and after flights. I know there are less expensive places in the area, but the dedication and care provided by their customer service is worth every penny!See more

Excellent Everything about this property is top notch. From the drivers/taxis they arrange, to the hotel staff, the quality and variety of food, to the constant cleanliness of the building; all of it is, as I say, top-notch. This is a superbly managed and well-run hotel.
Excellent We enjoyed our one night stay.

Excellent This is the best hotel I've found for being pet friendly. We are traveling with my cat and I requested a litter box for her. When we arrived, they already had the box set up in the room and it was an excellent experience for myself and my cat.
Excellent Clean, convenient location with shuttle to/from airport, good restaurant, very attentive staff.

Terrible I paid extra for the right to cancel my reservation in the event of something coming up and my travel was delayed so I was not able to check in on time. Neither the property nor Orbitz was willing to honor my cancellation insurance and I received no satisfaction. Boycott Holiday Inn AND Orbitz!
Terrible Beware!!! the person in the front desk told us we had complementary breakfast and end it up charging us $73 for it. I would never stay here again.

Excellent I've been into many hotels in my life and in here in Guayaquil I've been into several different ones this is the finest Hotel I've been in the service the quality of Staff the atmosphere the desire to serve the customer. The food the availability of services the Outreach of the staff to ensure that things were as they were or should be and if they could change or adjust or help to make things better they were most gracious and joyful in their service. Well laid out Hotel amenities everything you could want for at a very very fair price when you compare it to the hotels in town here the service quality safety all of these things add up to make for joyous occasion I spent four nights here with my daughters celebrating my birthday the staff allowed my daughter's to work with them to put on a small event in the dining room for breakfast with a mariachi band which all the customers got to enjoy and we had a wonderful celebration so yes this is our new home base in Guayaquil. comentario: Okay I’ve been a guest for many years because my husband it’s from Ecuador, but this time was last time I will spend my money there. OMG yes I know  it’s a first time for me too. Like I will pay $ 200 to steal your towel.  Plenty of other choices around .

Excellent This is my 2nd time staying at this hotel. I got no complaints, and I would definitely come back on my future visit to Ecuador.
The staff was very polite, attentive, and responsive. The check-in and check-out process is pretty fast, and there is always someone I can talk to or call.
I had a problem this time with the safe box. I had to call twice for someone to come; on my second call, they sent the guy in charge within 10 minutes. It is understandable; there are other people requesting assistance as well, so it was a big deal.

Terrible Nos quedamos en este hotel por su cercanía al aeropuerto. No espere mucho del personal de recepción. Pedimos información sobre locales de comida en el edificio y nos dieron información incorrecta. Afortunadamente uno de los botones que nos ayudó con las maletas ha escuchado la conversación y supo ayudarnos y nos dio la información correcta acerca de lugares de comer. 
Las habitaciones son pequeñas, viejas, las sábanas amarillentas, toallas viejas y tiesas, el baño pésimo, el lavamanos no se podía utilizar salía el agua por 2 segundos debido a sensores que terrible idea para una habitación de hotel. La alfombra que daba cosas pisarla nada que ver con la marca Wyndham. 
Había música alta que se escuchaba en nuestra habitación 
No regresaremos a esta ubicación.See more

Excellent Unipark was recommended by a family member and I have to say it did not disappoint. From the moment we checked-in until we checked out we were greeted by very friendly staff who went out of their way to make us feel welcome and made sure we enjoyed  our stay.  Our room was delightful with a nice view of the park and the cathedral, everything was clean and comfortable. The hotel’s restaurant had amazing local dishes! It is conveniently located within a shopping center next to the hotel. Right outside of the hotel there are taxi services that are ready to take you anywhere you want but the hotel is conveniently located within walking distance of shopping areas and restaurants. 
I am really happy that we booked our reservation with Unipark, The hotel is beautiful but the outstanding factor is hands-down the staff from the desk clerks, bellmen, housekeeping and the restaurant staff. All made our stay worth while and look forward to staying there again. See more
Excellent The valet person at C/I was amazing and helpful. Darwin at the restaurant was very attentive and courteous.

Excellent There are so many great things about this hotel and it’s staff. I don’t know where to begin. First, the hotel is clean, modern, and well organized. The staff makes you feel at home and treat you like a VIP all the time. In particular, there are three Valets, Cesar, William, and Mauricio, at the front desk that have gone above and beyond making me feel special, attending to any need that I have, and are extremely friendly. The hotel bar staff, Carol and Jennifer, are also friendly and attentive.
The hotel restaurant provides some of the best tasting food you can imagine. The breakfast buffet itself is incredible with a variety of breads, danishes, juices, hot and cold dishes, and you name it. I would also like to point out the Restaurant Captain, Darwin. He personally greets all the guests and has no problem bringing you coffee himself. He will go all out to make sure everyone has what they need.
I also want to mention that I was getting close the the end of my stay and my airlines contacted me to re-book for a later date due the a hurricane advisory on my return trip. I went to reservations and Belen was fantastic in making sure I could not only stay the extra days I needed but was able to keep me in the same room. I really appreciate Belen's efforts.
These are just some of the people I know by name but I can assure you that every staff member from this Hotel does the best they can to be friendly, polite, and ensure you are taken care of. See more

Good The hotel is in a great location. The room was clean and spacious enough for the two of us. We stayed here in two occasions so two different rooms. The first was on the 5th floor- the room was ok, but it looked old. The second time was on the 8th floor which was clearly newer but the carpet smelled like mold so it triggered my allergies badly.
